solvency opinion from an internationally recognized investment bank or accounting firm, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee confirming the solvency of the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, supplement, modification or replacement or release, (2) a certificate from the board of directors or the chief financial officer of the relevant Person or the Company amending, extending, renewing, restating, supplementing, modifying, replacing or releasing and retaking such Fixed Rate SSN Security Document which confirms the solvency of such Person after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification or release and retaking and replacement, or (3) an opinion of counsel, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (subject to customary exceptions and qualifications), confirming that, after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release and retaking, the Lien or Liens securing the Fixed Rate SSNs created under the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents so amended, extended, renewed, restated, supplemented, modified or replaced are valid and perfected Liens not otherwise subject to any limitation imperfection or new hardening period, in equity or at law, and that such Lien or Liens were not otherwise subject to immediately prior to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release and retaking. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent will be entitled to conclusively rely upon such certificate or opinion (as the case may be), without independent verification. At the direction of the Company and without the consent of the holders of Fixed Rate SSNs, the Security Agent may from time to time enter into one or more amendments to the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents to: 208 ----- (i) cure any ambiguity, omission, defect, manifest error or inconsistency therein, (ii) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) provide for Permitted Collateral Liens, (iii) add to the Collateral, (iv) comply with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, (v) evidence the succession of another Person to the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or a Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor and the assumption by such successor of the obligations under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs, the applicable Note Guarantee and the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents, in each case, in accordance with “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets” or in connection with a Permitted Reorganization or IPO Pushdown, (vi) provide for the release of property and assets constituting Collateral from the Lien of the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents or the release of the Note Guarantee of a Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, in each case, in accordance with (and if permitted by) the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, (vii) conform the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents to this “Description of the Fixed Rate Senior Secured _Notes”, (viii) evidence and provide for the acceptance of the appointment of a successor Fixed Rate SSN Trustee_ or Security Agent, (ix) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) to provide for Additional Fixed Rate SSNs to also benefit from the Collateral or (x) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) make any other change thereto that does not adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs in any material respect. In the event that the Company complies with this covenant, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent shall (subject to customary protections and indemnifications) consent to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release with no need for instructions from holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: At the request of the Company and without the consent of holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs, at the time of, or prior to, the Incurrence by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or a Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor of Indebtedness permitted to share in the Collateral, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent shall enter into with the holders of such Indebtedness (or their duly authorized representatives) an additional intercreditor agreement (an “Additional Intercreditor Agreement”) on substantially the same (or not materially less favorable to the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs) terms as the Intercreditor Agreement or an amendment to the Intercreditor Agreement (which amendment does not adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs in any material respect, as determined in good faith by the Company), it being understood that, for the avoidance of doubt, an increase in the amount of Indebtedness being subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement will be deemed to be on substantially similar terms to the Intercreditor Agreement and will be deemed not to adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs and will be permitted by this covenant if, in each case, the Incurrence of such Indebtedness (and any Lien in its favor) is permitted by the covenants described under the captions “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Preferred Stock” and “—Liens”. At the request of the Company, without the consent of holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, the Security Agent and the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall enter into one or more amendments to any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement to: (1) cure defects, resolve ambiguities or reflect changes, in each case, of a minor, technical or administrative nature, (2) increase the amount or types of Indebtedness covered by any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement that may be Incurred by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or a Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor that is subject to any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement (provided that such amendment is consistent with the preceding paragraph), (3) add new Restricted Subsidiaries, Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors or other parties (such as representatives of new issuances of Indebtedness) to the Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement, (4) further secure the Fixed Rate SSNs, (5) make provision for the security securing Additional Fixed Rate SSNs to rank pari passu with the Collateral, (6) implement any Permitted Collateral Liens, (7) amend the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement in accordance with the terms thereof, (8) to facilitate a Permitted Reorganization or Post-Closing Merger or (9) make any other change to any such Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement that does not adversely affect the rights of holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs in any material respect. The Company may only direct the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to enter into any amendment to the extent such amendment does not impose any personal obligations on the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent or adversely affect the rights, duties, liabilities or immunities of the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement. 209 ----- In relation to the Intercreditor Agreement or, to the extent applicable, an Additional Intercreditor Agreement, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall be deemed to have consented on behalf of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs to any payment, repayment, purchase, repurchase, defeasance, acquisition, retirement or redemption of any obligations subordinated to the Fixed Rate SSNs thereby; provided that such transaction would comply with the covenant described under “—Restricted Payments”. Each holder of the Fixed Rate SSNs shall be deemed to have agreed to and accepted the terms and conditions of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement (whether then entered into or entered into in the future pursuant to the provisions described herein) and to have consented to and directed the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to enter into any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any amendment of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement which complies with the foregoing provision and the conditions contained therein.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Suspension of Covenants When Fixed Rate SSNs Rated Investment Grade
Subsubsection Text: If on any date following the Issue Date: (1) the Fixed Rate SSNs have achieved Investment Grade Status; and (2) no Default or Event of Default shall have occurred and be continuing on such date, then, beginning on that day and continuing until such time, if any, at which the Fixed Rate SSNs cease to have Investment Grade Status (such period, the “Suspension Period”), the covenants specifically listed under the following captions in this “Description of the Fixed Rate Senior Secured Notes” will no longer be applicable to the Fixed Rate SSNs and any related default provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will cease to be effective and will not be applicable to the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries: (1) “—Repurchase at the Option of Holders—Asset Sales”; (2) “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Preferred Stock”; (3) “—Restricted Payments”; (4) “—Dividend and Other Payment Restrictions Affecting Restricted Subsidiaries”; (5) clause (4) of the first paragraph of the covenant described under “—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of _Assets”;_ (6) “—Transactions with Affiliates”; (7) “—Designation of Restricted and Unrestricted Subsidiaries”; (8) “—Limitation on Issuances of Guarantees of Indebtedness”; and (9) “—Impairment of Security Interests”. Such covenants will not, however, be of any effect with regard to the actions of Company and the Restricted Subsidiaries properly taken during the continuance of the Suspension Period; provided that (1) the covenant described under the caption “—Restricted Payments” will be interpreted as if it has been in effect since the date of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture other than during the Suspension Period, (2) all Indebtedness Incurred, or Disqualified Stock or Preferred Stock issued, during the Suspension Period will be classified to have been Incurred or issued pursuant to clause (2) of the second paragraph of the caption “—Incurrence of Indebtedness _and Issuance of Preferred Stock”, (3) any transactions prohibited by the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Transactions with Affiliates” entered into after such reinstatement pursuant to an agreement entered_ into during any Suspension Period shall be deemed to be permitted pursuant to clause (10) of the second paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Transactions with Affiliates,” and (4) any encumbrance or restriction on the ability of any Restricted Subsidiary to take any action described in clauses (1) through (3) of the first paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Dividend and _Other Payment Restrictions Affecting Restricted Subsidiaries” that becomes effective during any Suspension_ Period shall be deemed to be permitted pursuant to clause (3) of the second paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Dividend and Other Payment Restrictions Affecting Restricted Subsidiaries”. Upon the occurrence of a Suspension Period, the amount of Excess Proceeds shall be reset at zero. The Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the Company shall notify the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee upon the occurrence of a Suspension Period; provided that such notice shall not be a condition of the suspension of covenants described under this heading having effect and the failure to deliver such notice shall not be a Default or Event of Default under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture. There can be no assurance that the Fixed Rate SSNs will ever achieve or maintain an 210 ----- Investment Grade Status. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall have no duty to monitor the ratings of the Fixed Rate SSNs, shall not be deemed to have any knowledge of the ratings of the Fixed Rate SSNs and shall have no duty to notify Holders if the Fixed Rate SSNs achieve Investment Grade Status or upon the occurrence or cessation of any Suspension Period.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: When determining whether any transaction is permitted under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture (including, without limitation, determining compliance with any basket, ratio or threshold, or whether a Change of Control, Default or Event of Default has or would occur as a result of such transaction, in each case, in connection with the Incurrence of any Indebtedness (and use of proceeds thereof), the creation of any Lien, the making of any Restricted Payment or Investment, the issuance or sale of Capital Stock, the sale or other disposition of any assets, any merger, consolidation or other business combination or Affiliate Transaction), the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer shall be permitted to test it, at its option, (i) on the date binding documentation for such transaction is entered into, (ii) on the date that any notice of any repayment, redemption, repurchase or refinancing of any Indebtedness is given to the holders thereof (if applicable), or (iii) on the date such transaction is consummated. If the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer elects to test the transaction as described in clauses (i) or (ii) above, the determination as to whether the transaction is permitted under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture shall be made assuming that the transaction and other transactions to be entered into in connection therewith were consummated on the date binding documentation was entered into or such notice was given (each, an “Alternative Testing Date”), as applicable. If the transaction was permitted on the Alternative Testing Date chosen by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, it shall continue to be deemed so permitted under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture even if it would have otherwise resulted in a Default or an Event of Default on the date it is consummated. When determining whether any transaction is permitted under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture as of the Alternative Testing Date, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer will make all necessary calculations as set forth under the definitions of “Consolidated Net Leverage Ratio”, “Consolidated Net Senior Secured Leverage Ratio” and “Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio”. If the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer has elected to test a transaction on an Alternative Testing Date (an “Alternative _Testing Date Election”), the transaction shall be deemed to have occurred on such date for the purposes of_ making any other determination under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture; provided that an Alternative Testing Date Election shall cease to apply if (a) the transaction is definitively terminated, cancelled or abandoned or (b) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer has revoked its Alternative Testing Date Election and has instead opted to test the transaction on the date it is consummated, which the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer will be entitled to do at any time until the transaction is consummated (such time, the “Election Termination Time”). From the time the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer makes an Alternative Testing Date Election to the related Election Termination Time, the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will apply assuming that the relevant transaction was consummated on the Alternative Testing Date. No action properly taken by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries between an Alternative Testing Date Election and the related Election Termination Time will constitute a Default or an Event of Default under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture. In addition, the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will permit, without causing a Default or Event of Default, the Company or any of the Restricted Subsidiaries to honor any contractual commitments undertaken during such period of time, so long as they were not undertaken in anticipation of the Election Termination Time. When calculating a percentage of Consolidated EBITDA to determine compliance with any covenant herein, such percentage shall be measured based on the Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer for the most recently ended four full fiscal quarters for which internal financial statements are available immediately preceding the date of determination, calculated on a pro forma basis giving effect to the relevant transaction.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: So long as any Fixed Rate SSNs are outstanding, the Senior Notes Issuer will furnish to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee: (1) within 120 days after the end of the Senior Notes Issuer’s fiscal year beginning with the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022, annual reports containing the following information: (a) audited consolidated balance sheet of the Senior Notes Issuer as of the end of the most recent fiscal year (and comparative information for the end of the prior fiscal year) and audited consolidated income statement and statement of cash flow of the Senior Notes Issuer for the most recent fiscal year (and comparative information for the prior fiscal year), including footnotes to such financial statements and the report of 211 ----- the independent auditors on the financial statements; (b) to the extent applicable, pro forma income statement and balance sheet information of the Senior Notes Issuer, which, for the avoidance of doubt, shall not include the provision of a full income statement or balance sheet to the extent not reasonably available, together with explanatory footnotes, for any material acquisitions or dispositions (including, without limitation, any acquisitions or disposition that, individually or in the aggregate when considered with all other acquisition or dispositions that have occurred since the beginning of the most recently completed fiscal year as to which such annual report relates, represent greater than 20% of the consolidated revenues, EBITDA, or assets of the Senior Notes Issuer on a pro forma basis) or recapitalizations that have occurred since the beginning of the most recently completed fiscal year as to which such annual report relates, in each case unless pro forma information has been provided in a previous report pursuant to clause (2) or (3) below; provided that such pro forma financial information will be provided only to the extent available without unreasonable expense, in which case the Senior Notes Issuer will provide, in the case of a material acquisition, acquired company financial statements; (c) an operating and financial review of the audited financial statements, including a discussion of the results of operations (including a discussion by business segment, if any), financial condition and liquidity and capital resources, and a discussion of material commitments and contingencies and critical accounting policies; (d) a description of the business, management and shareholders of the Senior Notes Issuer, all material affiliate transactions, Indebtedness and material financing arrangements and a description of all material contractual arrangements, including material debt instruments; (e) material business risk factors and material recent developments; and (f) to the extent applicable, any changes to the description of the material differences in the financial condition and results of operations between the Company and the Senior Notes Issuer other than with respect to ownership (including any employee incentive plan or arrangement) or management (it being understood that any payment of interest on existing Indebtedness (including cash interest and pay in kind or capitalized interest) shall not constitute a material change); (2) within 60 days following the end of each of the first three fiscal quarters in each fiscal year of the Senior Notes Issuer beginning with the fiscal quarter ending June 30, 2021, quarterly reports containing the following information: (a) an unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet as of the end of such quarter and unaudited condensed statements of income and cash flow for the year to date periods ending on the unaudited condensed balance sheet date, and the comparable prior year periods for the Senior Notes Issuer, together with condensed footnote disclosure; (b) to the extent applicable, pro _forma income statement and balance sheet information, which, for the avoidance of doubt, shall not_ include the provision of a full income statement or balance sheet to the extent not reasonably available, together with explanatory footnotes, for any material acquisitions or dispositions (including, without limitation, any acquisition or disposition that, individually or in the aggregate when considered with all other acquisitions or dispositions that have occurred since the beginning of the most recent completed fiscal quarter as to which such quarterly report relates, represents greater than 20% of the consolidated revenues, EBITDA or assets of the Senior Notes Issuer on a pro forma basis) or recapitalizations that have occurred since the beginning of the most recently completed fiscal quarter as to which such quarterly report relates, in each case unless pro forma information has been provided in a previous report pursuant to clause (1), (2) or (3) of this covenant; provided that such pro forma financial information will be provided only to the extent available without unreasonable expense, in which case the Senior Notes Issuer will provide, in the case of a material acquisition, acquired company financial statements; (c) an operating and financial review of the unaudited financial statements (including a discussion by business segment, if any), including a discussion of the consolidated financial condition and results of operations of the Senior Notes Issuer and any material change between the current quarterly period and the corresponding period of the prior year; (d) material recent developments in the business of the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries; (e) any material changes to the business risk factors disclosed in the most recent annual report with respect to the Senior Notes Issuer; and (f) to the extent applicable, any changes to the description of the material differences in the financial condition and results of operations between the Company and the Senior Notes Issuer other than with respect to ownership (including any employee incentive plan or arrangement) or management (it being understood that any payment of interest on existing Indebtedness (including cash interest and pay in kind or capitalized interest) shall not constitute a material change); and (3) promptly after the occurrence of (a) a material acquisition, disposition or restructuring (including any acquisition or disposition that would require the delivery of pro forma financial information pursuant to clause (1) or (2) above); (b) any senior management change at the Senior Notes Issuer; (c) any change in the auditors of the Senior Notes Issuer; (d) any resignation of a member of the Board of Directors of the Senior Notes Issuer as a result of a disagreement with the Company or the Senior Notes Issuer, as 212 ----- applicable; (e) the entering into an agreement that will result in a Change of Control; or (f) any material events that the Senior Notes Issuer announces publicly, in each case, a report containing a description of such events; _provided, however, that the reports set forth in clauses (1), (2) and (3) above will not be required to_ (i) contain any reconciliation to U.S. generally accepted accounting principles or (ii) include separate financial statements for any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors or non-guarantor Subsidiaries of the Senior Notes Issuer. Delivery of such reports, information and documents to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall be for informational purposes only and the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee’s receipt of such shall not constitute actual or constructive notice of any information contained therein or determinable from information contained therein, including the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer’s compliance with any of its covenants under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or the Fixed Rate SSNs (as to which the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall be entitled to rely exclusively on Officer’s Certificates). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in respect of the reports set forth in clauses (1) and (2) above, if the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries have material operational activities other than the Company and its Subsidiaries for the periods that are the subject of such reports, as disclosed on such report, the Company shall provide each report required by clauses (1) and (2) above for such period as if each reference to “the Senior Notes Issuer” had been to “the Company”. At any time that any of the Company’s Subsidiaries are Unrestricted Subsidiaries and any such Unrestricted Subsidiary or group of Unrestricted Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, constitutes a Significant Subsidiary of the Company, then the quarterly and annual financial information required by the preceding paragraph will include a reasonably detailed presentation, either on the face of the financial statements or in the footnotes thereto, of the financial condition and results of operations of the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries (other than any Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Company) separate from the financial condition and results of operations of the Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Company. All financial statements shall be prepared in accordance with IFRS (without giving effect to the proviso in the definition thereof); provided, however, that the reports set forth in clauses (1), (2) and (3) above may, in the event of a change in applicable IFRS, present earlier periods on a basis that applied to such periods, subject to the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture. Except as provided for above, no report need include separate financial statements for the Company or Subsidiaries of the Company or any disclosure with respect to the results of operations or any other financial or statistical disclosure not of a type included in this offering memorandum. At its election, the Senior Notes Issuer may provide consolidated financial statements of a Parent Entity (or any new holding company created following a Permitted Reorganization) in lieu of those for the Senior Notes Issuer, in which case references to the Senior Notes Issuer in clauses (1) and (2) of the preceding paragraph will be deemed to be references to the Parent Entity or new holding company, as applicable. In addition, for so long as any Fixed Rate SSNs remain outstanding and during any period during which the Company is not subject to Section 13 or 15(d) of the U.S. Exchange Act nor exempt therefrom pursuant to Rule 12g3-2(b), the Company has agreed that it will furnish to the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs and to securities analysts and prospective investors, upon their request, the information required to be delivered pursuant to Rule 144A(d)(4) under the U.S. Securities Act. The Senior Notes Issuer will also make available copies of all reports required by clauses (1) through (3) of the first paragraph of the covenant (i) on the Senior Notes Issuer’s website and (ii) if and so long as the Fixed Rate SSNs are listed on the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange so require, at the specified office of the Fixed Rate SSN Paying Agent. In the event that, and for so long as, the equity securities of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Parent Entity or IPO Entity are listed on the regulated market of Euronext Paris (or one of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom) and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or such Parent Entity or IPO Entity is subject to the Admission and Disclosure Standards applicable to issuers of equity securities admitted to trading on the regulated market of Euronext Paris (or the equivalent standards applicable to issuers of equity securities admitted to trading on one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom), for so long as it elects, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer will make available to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee such annual and semiannual reports, information, documents and other reports that the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or such Parent Entity or IPO Entity is, or would be, required to file with Euronext Paris pursuant to such Admission and Disclosure Standards (or the applicable standards of one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom, as applicable). Upon 213 ----- complying with the foregoing requirements, and provided that such requirements require the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Parent Entity or IPO Entity to prepare and file annual and semiannual reports, information, documents and other reports with the regulated market of Euronext Paris, or one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom, as applicable, the Senior Notes Issuer and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer will be deemed to have complied with the provisions contained in the preceding paragraphs.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Each of the following is an “Event of Default”: (1) default for 30 days in the payment when due of interest or Additional Amounts, if any, with respect to the Fixed Rate SSNs; (2) default in the payment when due (at maturity, upon redemption or otherwise) of the principal of, or premium, if any, on, the Fixed Rate SSNs; (3) failure by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor for 60 days after written notice to the Company by the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the Fixed Rate SSNs then outstanding voting as a single class to comply with any of the agreements in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture (other than a default in performance, or breach, or a covenant or agreement which is specifically dealt with in clauses (1) or (2), or the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents); (4) default under any mortgage, indenture or instrument under which there may be issued or by which there may be secured or evidenced any Indebtedness for money borrowed by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries (or the payment of which is guaranteed by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries), whether such Indebtedness or guarantee now exists, or is created after the Issue Date, if that default: (a) is caused by a failure to pay principal of such Indebtedness at the Stated Maturity thereof prior to the expiration of the grace period provided in such Indebtedness on the date of such default (a “Payment Default”); or (b) results in the acceleration of such Indebtedness prior to its express maturity, and, in each case, the principal amount of any such Indebtedness, together with the principal amount of any other such Indebtedness under which there has been a Payment Default or the maturity of which has been so accelerated, aggregates €50 million or more; (5) failure by the Company or any Restricted Subsidiary to pay final judgments entered by a court or courts of competent jurisdiction aggregating in excess of €50 million (exclusive of any amounts that a solvent insurance company has acknowledged liability for), which judgments shall not have been discharged or waived and there shall have been a period of 60 consecutive days during which a stay of enforcement of such judgment or order, by reason of an appeal, waiver or otherwise, shall not have been in effect; (6) (i) any security interest created by the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents ceases to be in full force and effect (except as permitted by the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents) with respect to Collateral having a Fair Market Value in excess of €50.0 million and such failure to be in full force and effect has continued uncured for a period of 20 days or an assertion by the Company, any of its Restricted Subsidiaries or any grantor of any security interest over the Collateral that any Collateral is not subject to a valid, perfected security interest (except as permitted by the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents); or (ii) the repudiation by the Company or the grantor of any security interest over the Collateral of any of its material obligations under the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents; (7) except as permitted by the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, if any Note Guarantee is held in any judicial proceeding to be unenforceable or invalid or ceases for any reason to be in full force and effect and such Default continues for 20 days, or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor or any Person acting on behalf of any such Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, denies or disaffirms its obligations under its Note Guarantee; and (8) certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency described in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture with respect to the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries that is a Significant Subsidiary or any group of its Restricted Subsidiaries that, taken together (as of the latest audited consolidated financial statements for the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries), would constitute a Significant Subsidiary. 214 ----- In the case of an Event of Default specified in clause (8), all outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs will become due and payable immediately without further action or notice. If any other Event of Default occurs and is continuing, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs may and, if directed by holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall, declare all the Fixed Rate SSNs to be due and payable immediately. For the avoidance of doubt, it will not constitute an Event of Default if the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer fails to satisfy the Sustainability Performance Targets by December 31, 2023, or fails to provide reports with respect to its performance against the Sustainability Performance Targets, and the sole recourse of holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs in such instance shall be the right to receive the applicable increase in interest rate, in the manner described under the heading “—Principal, Maturity and Interest” and the associated change to the optional redemption prices under the heading “—Optional Redemption”. Subject to certain limitations, holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs may direct the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in its exercise of any trust or power. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee may withhold from holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs notice of any continuing Default or Event of Default if it determines that withholding notice is in their interest, except a Default or Event of Default relating to the payment of principal, interest or Additional Amounts or premium, if any. Subject to the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture relating to the duties of the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, in case an Event of Default occurs and is continuing, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be under no obligation to exercise any of the rights or powers under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture at the request or direction of any holders of Fixed Rate SSNs unless such holders have offered to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee indemnity and/or security (including by way of prefunding) satisfactory to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in its sole discretion against any loss, liability or expense. Except (subject to the provisions described under “—Amendment, _Supplement and Waiver”) to enforce the right to receive payment of principal, premium, if any, or interest or_ Additional Amounts when due, no holder of a Fixed Rate SSN may pursue any remedy with respect to the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or the Fixed Rate SSNs unless: (1) such holder has previously given the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee notice that an Event of Default is continuing; (2) holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs have requested the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee to pursue the remedy; (3) such holders have offered the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee security and/or indemnity (including by way of prefunding) satisfactory to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in its sole discretion against any loss, liability or expense; (4) the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee has not complied with such request within 60 days after the receipt of the request and the offer of security and/or indemnity (including by way of prefunding); and (5) holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs have not given the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee a direction inconsistent with such request within such 60-day period. The holders of not less than a majority in aggregate principal amount of the Fixed Rate SSNs outstanding may, on behalf of the holders of all outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs, waive any past Default under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture and its consequences, except a continuing Default in the payment of the principal or premium, if any, any Additional Amounts or interest on any Fixed Rate SSN held by a non-consenting holder (which may only be waived with the consent of holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs holding 90% of the aggregate principal amount of the Fixed Rate SSNs outstanding under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture). Holders of Fixed Rate SSNs may not enforce the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents, except as provided in the Intercreditor Agreement. The Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will provide that in the event an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing of which the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee has written notice, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be required in the exercise of its powers to use the degree of care that a prudent person would use in the conduct of its own affairs. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, however, may refuse to follow any direction that conflicts with law or the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or that the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee determines is materially prejudicial to the rights of any other Holder or that would involve the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in personal liability. The Company is required to deliver to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee annually a statement regarding compliance with the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture within 120 days after the end of each financial year. The Fixed 215 ----- Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent may assume without inquiry, in the absence of actual knowledge, that the Company and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer are duly complying with their obligations contained in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture required to be observed and performed by them, and that no Default or Event of Default or other event that would require repayment of the Fixed Rate SSNs has occurred. The Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will provide that (i) if a Default (a “Subsequent Default”) occurs solely as a result of an action taken while a Default (an “Initial Default”) for a failure to deliver a required certificate (unrelated to the action in respect of the Subsequent Default) is pending and the Initial Default is cured, such Subsequent Default will also be cured without any further action and (ii) any Default or Event of Default for the failure to comply with the time periods prescribed in the covenant entitled “—Reports” or otherwise to deliver any notice or certificate pursuant to any other provision of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture shall be deemed to be cured upon the delivery of any such report required by such covenant or notice or certificate, as applicable, even though such delivery is not within the prescribed period specified in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: No Personal Liability of Directors, Officers, Employees and Stockholders
Subsubsection Text: No director, officer, employee, authorized signatory, incorporator or stockholder of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, as such, will have any liability for any obligations of the Company or the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors under the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Note Guarantees, the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or for any claim based on, in respect of, or by reason of, such obligations or their creation. Each holder of Fixed Rate SSNs by accepting a Fixed Rate SSN waives and releases all such liability. The waiver and release are part of the consideration for issuance of the Fixed Rate SSNs. The waiver may not be effective to waive liabilities under applicable securities laws.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Fixed Rate SSN Issuer may at any time, at the option of its Board of Directors evidenced by a resolution set forth in an Officer’s Certificate, elect to have all of its obligations discharged with respect to the outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs and all obligations of the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors discharged with respect to their Note Guarantees (“Legal Defeasance”) except for: (1) the rights of holders of outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs to receive payments in respect of the principal of, or interest (including Additional Amounts) or premium, if any, on, such Fixed Rate SSNs when such payments are due from the trust referred to below; (2) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer’s obligations with respect to the Fixed Rate SSNs concerning issuing temporary Fixed Rate SSNs, registration of Fixed Rate SSNs, mutilated, destroyed, lost or stolen Fixed Rate SSNs and the maintenance of an office or agency for payment and money for security payments held in trust; (3) the rights, powers, trusts, duties and immunities of the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer’s and the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors’ obligations in connection therewith; and (4) the Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture. In addition, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer may, at its option and at any time, elect to have the obligations of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors released with respect to certain covenants (including its obligation to make Change of Control Offers and Asset Sale Offers) that are described in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture (“Covenant Defeasance”) and thereafter any omission to comply with those covenants will not constitute a Default or Event of Default with respect to the Fixed Rate SSNs. In the event Covenant Defeasance occurs, all Events of Default described under “—Events of Default and Remedies” (except those relating to payments on the Fixed Rate SSNs or, solely with respect to the Company, bankruptcy or insolvency events) will no longer constitute an Event of Default with respect to the Fixed Rate SSNs. In order to exercise either Legal Defeasance or Covenant Defeasance: (1) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must irrevocably deposit with the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, in trust, for the benefit of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs, cash in euro, non-callable European Government Obligations or a combination of cash in euro and non-callable European Government Obligations, in amounts as will be sufficient, in the opinion of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, acting in good faith, to pay the principal of, or interest (including Additional Amounts and premium, if any) on the outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs on the stated date for payment thereof or on the applicable redemption date, as the case may be, and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must specify whether the Fixed Rate SSNs are being defeased to such stated date for payment or to a particular redemption date; 216 ----- (2) in the case of Legal Defeasance, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee an opinion reasonably acceptable to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee of United States counsel confirming that (i) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer has received from, or there has been published by, the U.S. Internal Revenue Service a ruling or (ii) since the Issue Date, there has been a change in the applicable U.S. Federal income tax law, in either case to the effect that, and based thereon such opinion of counsel will confirm that, the holders of the outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs will not recognize income, gain or loss for U.S. Federal income tax purposes as a result of such Legal Defeasance and will be subject to tax on the same amounts, in the same manner and at the same times as would have been the case if such Legal Defeasance had not occurred; (3) in the case of Covenant Defeasance, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, an opinion reasonably acceptable to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee of United States counsel confirming that the holders of the outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs will not recognize income, gain or loss for U.S. Federal income tax purposes as a result of such Covenant Defeasance and will be subject to U.S. Federal income tax on the same amounts, in the same manner and at the same times as would have been the case if such Covenant Defeasance had not occurred; (4) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee an Officer’s Certificate stating that the deposit was not made by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer with the intent of preferring the holders of Fixed Rate SSNs over the other creditors of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer with the intent of defeating, hindering, delaying or defrauding any creditors of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or others; and (5) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee an Officer’s Certificate and an opinion of counsel, subject to customary assumptions and qualifications, each stating that all conditions precedent relating to the Legal Defeasance or the Covenant Defeasance have been complied with. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be entitled to conclusively rely upon such Officer’s Certificates and opinions without independent verification.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Except as provided otherwise in the succeeding paragraphs, the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees, the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement may be amended or supplemented with the consent of the holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the Fixed Rate SSNs then outstanding (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Fixed Rate SSNs), and any existing Default or Event of Default or compliance with any provision of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees, the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement may be waived with the consent of the holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Fixed Rate SSNs). Unless consented to by the holders of at least 90% (or in the case of clause (10) below, 80%) of the aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Fixed Rate SSNs), an amendment, supplement or waiver may not (with respect to any Fixed Rate SSNs held by a non-consenting holder): (1) reduce the principal amount of Fixed Rate SSNs whose holders must consent to an amendment, supplement or waiver; (2) reduce the principal of or change the fixed maturity of any Fixed Rate SSN or alter the provisions with respect to the redemption of the Fixed Rate SSNs (other than provisions relating to the covenants described above under the caption “—Repurchase at the Option of Holders”); (3) reduce the rate of or change the time for payment of interest, including default interest, on any Fixed Rate SSN; (4) impair the contractual right of any holder of Fixed Rate SSNs to receive payment of principal of and interest on such holder’s Fixed Rate SSNs on or after the due dates therefor or to institute suit for the enforcement of any payment on or with respect to such holder’s Fixed Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee in respect thereof; (5) waive a Default or Event of Default in the payment of principal of, or interest, Additional Amounts or premium, if any, on, the Fixed Rate SSNs (except a rescission of acceleration of the Fixed Rate SSNs 217 ----- by the holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs and a waiver of the Payment Default that resulted from such acceleration); (6) make any Fixed Rate SSN payable in money other than that stated in the Fixed Rate SSNs; (7) make any change in the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture relating to waivers of past Defaults or the rights of holders of Fixed Rate SSNs to receive payments of principal of, or interest, Additional Amounts or premium, if any, on, the Fixed Rate SSNs; (8) make any change in the preceding amendment and waiver provisions; (9) release all or substantially all the Note Guarantees, except in accordance with the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement; or (10) release all or substantially all the security interests granted for the benefit of the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs in the Collateral, except in accordance with the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents. Notwithstanding the preceding paragraphs, without the consent of any holder of Fixed Rate SSNs, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and, with respect to the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Agent may amend or supplement the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs, any Note Guarantee, any of the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents or the Intercreditor Agreement: (1) to cure any ambiguity, defect, error or inconsistency (including, for the avoidance of doubt, any inconsistency with any other provision in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture (including any supplemental indenture), the Fixed Rate SSNs, any Note Guarantee, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any Fixed Rate SSN Security Document or any disclosure in the Offering Memorandum) or reduce the minimum denomination of the Fixed Rate SSNs; (2) to provide for uncertificated Fixed Rate SSNs in addition to or in place of certificated Fixed Rate SSNs; (3) to provide for the assumption of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer’s or a Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor’s obligations to holders of Fixed Rate SSNs and Note Guarantees in the case of a merger or consolidation or sale of all or substantially all of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer’s or such Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor’s assets or in the case of a Permitted Reorganization or IPO Pushdown, as applicable, and make corresponding amendments; (4) to make any change that would provide any additional rights or benefits to the holders of Fixed Rate SSNs or that does not adversely affect the legal rights under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture of any such holder in any material respect; (5) to conform the text of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents to any provision of this “Description of the Fixed Rate Senior _Secured Notes” to the extent that such provision in this “Description of the Fixed Rate Senior Secured Notes” was intended to be a verbatim recitation of a provision of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the_ Fixed Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents; (6) to enter into additional or supplemental Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents; (7) to release any Note Guarantee in accordance with the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture; (8) to release the Collateral in accordance with the terms of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture and the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents; (9) to provide for the issuance of Additional Fixed Rate SSNs in accordance with the limitations set forth in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture; (10) to allow any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor to execute a supplemental indenture and/or a Note Guarantee with respect to the Fixed Rate SSNs; (11) to evidence and provide the acceptance of the appointment of a successor Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any Fixed Rate SSN Security Document; (12) as provided under “—Certain Covenants—Impairment of Security Interests” or “—Additional _Intercreditor Agreements”;_ 218 ----- (13) to comply with the covenant “—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets”; (14) to make any amendment to the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture relating to the transfer and legending of the Fixed Rate SSNs as permitted by the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, including, without limitation, to facilitate the issuance and administration of the Fixed Rate SSNs; provided that compliance with the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture as so amended may not result in the Fixed Rate SSNs being transferred in violation of the U.S. Securities Act or any applicable securities laws; or (15) to comply with the rules of any applicable securities depositary. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (where relevant) shall, at the direction of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, sign any supplemental indenture or other documentation that gives effect to amendments, supplements or waivers authorized as described under this heading “Amendment, Supplement and Waiver” if the amendment, supplement or waiver does not impose any personal obligations on the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent. It shall only be necessary for the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (where relevant) to authorize and execute a supplemental indenture or other documentation in order to effect an amendment, waiver or supplement authorized as described under this heading “Amendment, _Supplement and Waiver”; provided that, only the consent of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, the Fixed Rate SSN_ Trustee, the Security Agent (where relevant) and the relevant Additional Note Guarantor shall be required to give effect to any amendment or supplement providing for Additional Note Guarantees or security or modifying the terms of Note Guarantees or security pursuant to clauses (3), (5), (6), (7), (8), (10) or (12) above. The Security Agent shall not be required to authorize or execute any amendment to the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs or the Note Guarantees unless such modification or amendment adversely affects the legal rights of the Security Agent. Unless otherwise specified by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, a waiver authorized as described under this heading “Amendment, Supplement and Waiver” will become effective once the requisite consent of Holders has been obtained, without execution of any supplemental indenture or other documentation. The consent of the holders of Fixed Rate SSNs is not necessary under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture to approve the particular form of any proposed amendment. It is sufficient if such consent approves the substance of the proposed amendment. In formulating its opinion on such matters, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall be entitled to rely absolutely on such evidence as it deems appropriate, including opinions of counsel and Officer’s Certificates.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will be discharged and will cease to be of further effect as to all Fixed Rate SSNs issued thereunder, when: (1) either: (a) all Fixed Rate SSNs that have been authenticated, except lost, stolen or destroyed Fixed Rate SSNs that have been replaced or paid and Fixed Rate SSNs for whose payment money has been deposited in trust and thereafter repaid to the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, have been delivered to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee for cancellation; or (b) all Fixed Rate SSNs that have not been delivered to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee for cancellation have become due and payable by reason of the mailing of a notice of redemption or otherwise or will become due and payable within one year and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor has irrevocably deposited or caused to be deposited with the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee (or such entity designated (as agent) by the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee for such purposes) as trust funds in trust solely for the benefit of the holders, cash in euro, non-callable European Government Obligations or a combination of cash in euro and non-callable European Government Obligations, in amounts as will be sufficient, without consideration of any reinvestment of interest, to pay and discharge the entire Indebtedness on the Fixed Rate SSNs not delivered to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee for cancellation for principal, premium and Additional Amounts, if any, and accrued interest to the date of maturity or redemption; (2) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor has paid or caused to be paid all sums payable by it under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture; and (3) the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer has delivered irrevocable instructions to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture to apply the deposited money toward the payment of the Fixed Rate SSNs at maturity or on the redemption date, as the case may be. 219 ----- In addition, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer must deliver an Officer’s Certificate and an opinion of counsel to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee stating that all conditions precedent to satisfaction and discharge have been satisfied; _provided that any such counsel may rely on any Officer’s Certificate as to matters of fact (including as to_ compliance with the foregoing clauses (1), (2) and (3)). If requested by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee shall distribute any amounts deposited in trust to the holders prior to maturity or the redemption date, as the case may be; provided, however, that the Holders shall have received at least three Business Days’ notice from the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer of such earlier repayment date (which may be included in the notice of redemption). For the avoidance of doubt, the distribution and payments to Holders prior to the maturity or redemption date as set forth above will not include any negative interest, present value adjustment, break cost or any other premium on such amounts. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and each Fixed Rate SSN Paying Agent shall not be liable to any Person for the distribution of funds to Holders early as described in this paragraph. To the extent the Fixed Rate SSNs are represented by a Global Note deposited with a common depositary for a clearing system, any payment to the beneficial holders holding Book-Entry Interests as participants of such clearing system will be subject to the then applicable procedures of such clearing system.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Any payment on account of an amount that is payable in euro which is made to or for the account of any holder or the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in lawful currency of any other jurisdiction (the “Judgment Currency”), whether as a result of any judgment or order or the enforcement thereof or the liquidation of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor, shall constitute a discharge of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor’s obligation under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture and the Fixed Rate SSNs or the Note Guarantee, as the case may be, only to the extent of the amount of euro that such holder or the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, as the case may be, could purchase in the London foreign exchange markets with the amount of the Judgment Currency in accordance with normal banking procedures at the rate of exchange prevailing on the first Business Day following receipt of the payment in the Judgment Currency. If the amount of euro that could be so purchased is less than the amount of euro originally due to such holder or the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, as the case may be, the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors shall indemnify and hold harmless the holder or the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, as the case may be, from and against all loss or damage arising out of, or as a result of, such deficiency. This indemnity shall constitute an obligation separate and independent from the other obligations contained in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture or the Fixed Rate SSNs, shall give rise to a separate and independent cause of action, shall apply irrespective of any indulgence granted by any holder or the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee from time to time and shall continue in full force and effect notwithstanding any judgment or order for a liquidated sum in respect of an amount due hereunder or under any judgment or order.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: Concerning the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee
Subsubsection Text: The Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or the Company shall deliver written notice to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee within 30 days of becoming aware of the occurrence of a Default or an Event of Default and the action which is being taken in respect thereof. The Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be permitted to engage in other transactions; however, if it acquires actual knowledge of any conflicting interest in its capacity as Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, it must eliminate such conflict within 90 days or resign as Fixed Rate SSN Trustee. The holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Fixed Rate SSNs will have the right to direct the time, method and place of conducting any proceeding for exercising any remedy available to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, subject to certain exceptions. The Fixed Rate SSN Indenture provides that in case an Event of Default occurs and is continuing of which the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee has written notice, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be required, in the exercise of its power, to use the degree of care of a prudent man in the conduct of his own affairs. Subject to such provisions, the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee will be under no obligation to exercise any of its rights or powers under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture at the request of any holder of Fixed Rate SSNs, unless such holder has offered to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee security and/or indemnity (including by way of prefunding) satisfactory to the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee in its sole discretion against any loss, liability or expense. The Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors will indemnify the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee for certain claims, liabilities and expenses incurred without negligence, willful misconduct or fraud on its part arising out of or in connection with its duties. 220 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Application will be made to list the Fixed Rate SSNs on the Official List of the Exchange and to admit the Fixed Rate SSNs to trading on the Exchange. There can be no assurance that the application to list the Fixed Rate SSNs on the Official List of the Exchange and to admit the Fixed Rate SSNs to trading on the Exchange will be approved and settlement of the Fixed Rate SSNs is not conditioned on obtaining this listing.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Anyone who receives this offering memorandum may, following the Issue Date, obtain a copy of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the form of Fixed Rate SSN, the Fixed Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement without charge by writing to Picard Groupe S.A.S. at 17-19, place de la Résistance, 92446 Issy-lesMoulineaux Cedex, Paris, France. So long as the Fixed Rate SSNs are listed on the Exchange and admitted for trading on the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange shall so require, copies of the financial statements included in this Offering Memorandum may be obtained, free of charge, during normal business hours at the offices of the Fixed Rate SSN Principal Paying Agent.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: Consent to Jurisdiction and Service of Process
Subsubsection Text: The Fixed Rate SSN Indenture will provide that the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and each Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor will appoint an agent for service of process in any suit, action or proceeding with respect to the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate SSNs and the Note Guarantees brought in any U.S. federal or New York state court located in the Borough of Manhattan, City of New York and will submit to such jurisdiction. The application of the provisions of articles 470-1 to 470-19 of the Luxembourg law dated 10 August 1915 on commercial companies, as amended, is hereby expressly excluded.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Substantially all of the assets of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and the Fixed Rate SSN Guarantors are outside the United States. As a result, any judgment obtained in the United States against the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor may not be collectable within the United States.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Claims against the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor for the payment of principal or Additional Amounts, if any, on the Fixed Rate SSNs will be prescribed ten years after the applicable due date for payment thereof. Claims against the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or any Fixed Rate SSN Guarantor for the payment of interest on the Fixed Rate SSNs will be prescribed five years after the applicable due date for payment of interest.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FIXED RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Set forth below are certain defined terms used in the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture. Reference is made to the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture for a full disclosure of all defined terms used therein, as well as any other capitalized terms used herein for which no definition is provided. “Acquired Debt” means, with respect to any specified Person, Indebtedness of any other Person existing at the time such other Person is merged with or into or becomes a Subsidiary of such specified Person, whether or not such Indebtedness is incurred in connection with, or in contemplation of, such other Person merging with or into, or becoming a Restricted Subsidiary. “Affiliate” of any specified Person means any other Person directly or indirectly controlling or controlled by or under direct or indirect common control with such specified Person. For purposes of this definition, “control,” as used with respect to any Person, means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by agreement or otherwise. For purposes of this definition, the terms “controlling,” “controlled by” and “under common control with” have correlative meanings. “Agent” means each Fixed Rate SSN Paying Agent, Fixed Rate SSN Registrar and transfer agent. 221 ----- “Applicable Premium” means, with respect to any Fixed Rate SSN on any redemption date, the greater of: (1) 1.0% of the principal amount of such Fixed Rate SSN; and (2) the excess of: (a) the present value at such redemption date of (i) the redemption price of such Fixed Rate SSNs on, 2023, plus (ii) all required interest payments due on such Fixed Rate SSN through , 2023 (excluding accrued but unpaid interest to the redemption date) computed using a discount rate equal to the Bund Rate as of such redemption date plus 50 basis points; over (b) the outstanding principal amount of such Fixed Rate SSN, in each case, as calculated by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or on behalf of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer by such Person as the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer shall designate. For the avoidance of doubt, calculation of the Applicable Premium shall not be an obligation or duty of the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee, the Fixed Rate SSN Registrar, the transfer agent or any Fixed Rate SSN Paying Agent. “Asset Sale” means: (1) the sale, lease, conveyance or other disposition of any assets by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries; provided that the sale, lease, conveyance or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries taken as a whole will be governed by the provisions of the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture described above under the caption “—Repurchase at the _Option of Holders—Change of Control” and/or the provisions described above under the caption_ “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets” and not by the provisions described under the caption “—Repurchase at the Option of Holders—Asset Sales”; and (2) the issuance of Equity Interests by any Restricted Subsidiary or the sale by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Equity Interests in any of the Company’s Subsidiaries (in each case, other than directors’ qualifying shares). Notwithstanding the preceding, none of the following items will be deemed to be an Asset Sale: (1) any single transaction or series of related transactions that involves assets having a Fair Market Value of less than the greater of €30.0 million and 10% of Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer; (2) a transfer of assets or Equity Interests between or among the Company and any Restricted Subsidiary or as part of or pursuant to an equity incentive or compensation plan approved by the Board of Directors of the Company; (3) an issuance of Equity Interests by a Restricted Subsidiary to the Company or to a Restricted Subsidiary; (4) the sale, lease or other transfer of accounts receivable, inventory, trading stock, communications capacity and other assets (including any real or personal property) in the ordinary course of business (including the abandonment or other disposition of intellectual property that is, in the reasonable judgment of the Company, no longer economically practicable to maintain or useful in the conduct of business of the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries taken as a whole); (5) licenses and sublicenses by the Company or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of software or intellectual property in the ordinary course of business; (6) any surrender or waiver of contract rights or the settlement, release, recovery on or surrender of contract, tort or other claims in the ordinary course of business; (7) the granting of Liens not prohibited by the covenant described above under the caption “—Liens”; (8) the sale or other disposition of cash, Cash Equivalents, Temporary Cash Investments or Investment Grade Securities; (9) a Restricted Payment that does not violate the covenant described above under the caption “—Certain _Covenants—Restricted Payments”, a Permitted Investment or any Permitted Payment;_ (10) the disposition of receivables in connection with the compromise, settlement or collection thereof in the ordinary course of business or in bankruptcy or similar proceedings and exclusive of factoring or similar arrangements; 222 ----- (11) the foreclosure, condemnation or any similar action with respect to any property or other assets or a surrender or waiver of contract rights or the settlement, release or surrender of contract, tort or other claims of any kind; (12) the disposition of assets to a Person who is providing services (the provision of which have been or are to be outsourced by the Company or any Restricted Subsidiary to such Person) related to such assets; (13) any sale or other disposition of Equity Interests in, or Indebtedness or other securities of, an Unrestricted Subsidiary; (14) any exchange of assets (including a combination of assets and Cash Equivalents) for assets related to a Similar Business of comparable or greater market value or usefulness to the business of the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries as a whole, as determined in good faith by the Company; (15) any disposition of Capital Stock of a Restricted Subsidiary pursuant to an agreement or other obligation with or to a Person (other than the Company or a Restricted Subsidiary) from whom such Restricted Subsidiary was acquired or from whom such Restricted Subsidiary acquired its business and assets (having been newly formed in connection with such acquisition), made as part of such acquisition and in each case comprising all or a portion of the consideration in respect of such sale or acquisition; (16) any sale or other disposition of (a) any loss making store site, (b) to the extent taking the form of a sale or other disposition, any sale or disposition of any store site in connection with its relocation to a different site, and (c) no more than 20 store sites (other than pursuant to clauses (a) and (b) of this paragraph (16)) in each fiscal year; (17) a disposition that is made in connection with the establishment of a joint venture or sales, transfers and other dispositions of Investments in joint ventures to the extent required by or made pursuant to, customary buy/sell arrangements between the joint venture parties set forth in joint venture agreements and similar binding agreements; provided that any cash or Cash Equivalents received in such sale, transfer or other disposition is applied in accordance with the covenant described under “—Repurchase _at the Option of Holders—Asset Sales”;_ (18) sales or dispositions of receivables in connection with any Qualified Receivables Financing or any factoring transaction or in the ordinary course of business; (19) a disposition that is made in connection with the factoring or discounting of vendor loans to franchisees in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed €30 million; (20) a disposition of obsolete, worn-out, damaged or surplus property, equipment or other assets or property, or equipment or other assets that are no longer useful in the business of the Company and its Restricted Subsidiaries whether now or hereafter owned, leased or acquired; (21) the unwinding of any cash management services or Hedging Obligations; and (22) transactions permitted under “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets”, any Permitted Reorganization or a transaction that constitutes a Change of Control. “Associate” means (i) any Person engaged in a Permitted Business of which the Company or its Restricted Subsidiaries are the legal and beneficial owners of between 20% and 50% of all outstanding Voting Stock and (ii) any joint venture entered into by the Company or any Restricted Subsidiary of the Company. “Assurance Letter” means an assurance letter from the External Verifier as to whether a Sustainability Performance Target has been attained. “Beneficial Owner” has the meaning assigned to such term in Rule 13d-3 and Rule 13d-5 under the U.S. Exchange Act; provided that any Voting Stock of which any Permitted Holder is the “beneficial owner” (as so defined) (other than deemed beneficial ownership derived from membership in a group) shall not be included in any Voting Stock of which any other person or group is the “beneficial owner” (as so defined), unless that person or group is not an Affiliate of a Permitted Holder and has the sole voting power with respect to that Voting Stock. The terms “Beneficially Owns” and “Beneficially Owned” have a corresponding meaning. “Board of Directors” means: (1) with respect to a corporation, the board of directors or supervisory board of the corporation or any committee thereof duly authorized to act on behalf of such board; (2) with respect to a partnership, the board of directors of the general partner of the partnership; 223 ----- (3) with respect to a limited liability company, the board of managers, the managing member or members or any controlling committee of managing members thereof; and (4) with respect to any other Person, the board or committee of such Person serving a similar function. “Bund Rate” as selected by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, means the yield to maturity at the time of computation of direct obligations of the Federal Republic of Germany (Bunds or Bundesanleihen) with a constant maturity (as officially compiled and published in the most recent financial statistics that have become publicly available at least two Business Days (but not more than five Business Days) prior to the redemption date (or, if such financial statistics are not so published or available, any publicly available source of similar market data selected in good faith by the Board of Directors or an Officer of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer)) most nearly equal to the period from the redemption date to, 2023; provided, however, that if the period from the redemption date to, 2023 is not equal to the constant maturity of a direct obligation of the Federal Republic of Germany for which a weekly average yield is given, the Bund Rate shall be obtained by linear interpolation (calculated to the nearest one-twelfth of a year) from the weekly average yields of direct obligations of the Federal Republic of Germany for which such yields are given, except that if the period from such redemption date to, 2023 is less than one year, the weekly average yield on actually traded direct obligations of the Federal Republic of Germany adjusted to a constant maturity of one year shall be used. “Business Day” means a day other than a Saturday, Sunday or other day on which banking institutions in London, Paris or New York or a place of payment under the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture are authorized or required by law to close. “Capital Lease Obligation” means, at the time any determination is to be made, an obligation that is at that time required to be classified and accounted for as lease liabilities on a balance sheet (excluding the footnotes thereto) prepared in accordance with IFRS, and the Stated Maturity thereof shall be the date of the last payment of rent or any other amount due under such lease prior to the first date upon which such lease may be terminated or prepaid by the lessee without payment of a penalty. “Capital Stock” means: (1) in the case of a corporation, corporate stock;
