Subsubsection Text: The Note Guarantee of any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor (other than the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, Lion Polaris II, MidCo and the Senior Notes Issuer) will be released: (1) in connection with any sale, disposition, exchange or other transfer of all or substantially all of the assets of that Floating Rate SSN Guarantor (including by way of merger, consolidation, amalgamation or combination) to a Person that is not (either before or after giving effect to such transaction) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, if the sale or other disposition does not violate the “Asset Sale” provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (2) in connection with any sale, disposition, exchange or other transfer of Capital Stock of that Floating Rate SSN Guarantor to a Person that is not (either before or after giving effect to such transaction) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, if the sale or other disposition does not violate the “Asset Sale” provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantor ceases to be a Restricted Subsidiary as a result of the sale or other disposition; (3) if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer designates any Restricted Subsidiary that is a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (4) upon legal defeasance, covenant defeasance or satisfaction and discharge of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture as provided below under the captions “—Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance” and “—Satisfaction and Discharge;” (5) upon the sale of all the Capital Stock of, or all or substantially all of the assets of, such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor or its Parent Entity pursuant to a security enforcement sale in compliance with the Intercreditor Agreement, or as otherwise provided for under the Intercreditor Agreement; (6) upon the full and final payment and performance of all obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs; (7) in the case of any Restricted Subsidiary that after the Issue Date is required to guarantee the Floating Rate SSNs pursuant to the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Issuances _of Guarantees of Indebtedness,” upon the release or discharge of the guarantee of Indebtedness by such_ Restricted Subsidiary which resulted in the obligation to guarantee such Floating Rate SSNs; (8) as described or permitted under “—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver”, “—Certain Covenants— _Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets” or “IPO Pushdown”;_ (9) in connection with a Permitted Reorganization; or (10) in connection with any Post-Closing Merger, in which case the Note Guarantee of the non-surviving entity or entities will be released. The Note Guarantees of each of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, Lion Polaris II, MidCo and the Senior Notes Issuer will be released upon the circumstances described under sub-clauses (4), (5), (6), (8) and (9) above. The Note Guarantees of each of MidCo and/or Lion Polaris II, as the case may be, will also be released upon the circumstances described under sub-clause (10) above. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall have the right, in its sole discretion, by written notice to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee delivered prior to the automatic release and termination of any Note Guarantee as specified above, to (A) waive such automatic release and termination of such Note Guarantee and maintain such Note Guarantee in effect until such time as the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall instruct and direct the Floating Rate SSN Trustee in writing to release and terminate such Note Guarantee or (B) elect that the release and termination of such Note Guarantee shall not occur automatically as contemplated by the two preceding paragraphs but shall occur at such time or times, in such manner and order and upon the occurrence of such other events as shall be specified by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer in such notice to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee; provided further that 263 ----- nothing in this clause (B) shall allow the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to require the release and termination of any Note Guarantee prior to (unless such release and termination is to occur substantially concurrently with) the occurrence of the applicable event(s) set forth in clauses (1) through (10) above. Upon any occurrence giving rise to a release as specified above, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, subject to receipt of an Officer’s Certificate certifying which circumstance, as set forth above, giving rise to the release of such Note Guarantee has occurred and that such release complies with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and (other than in connection with a Post-Closing Merger as described in clause (10) above) an opinion of counsel, will execute any documents reasonably required in order to evidence or effect such release, discharge and termination in respect of such guarantee. Neither the Floating Rate SSN Issuer nor any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor will be required to make a notation on the Floating Rate SSNs to reflect any such release, termination or discharge.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: At the Issue Date, the Floating Rate SSNs will be guaranteed by each Initial Floating Rate SSN Guarantor. The Note Guarantees will be joint and several obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors. Each Note Guarantee will be a general senior obligation of the relevant Floating Rate SSN Guarantor. Each of the Note Guarantees and the amounts recoverable thereunder will be limited to the maximum amount that can be guaranteed by a particular Floating Rate SSN Guarantor without rendering its guarantee voidable or otherwise ineffective under applicable law. In addition, the Note Guarantee of any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor incorporated under the laws of France (each, a “French Guarantor”) will apply only in so far as required to: (1) guarantee the payment obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs, of its direct or indirect French Subsidiaries which are or become obligors from time to time under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs; and 261 ----- (2) guarantee the payment obligations of other obligors under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs which are not direct or indirect Subsidiaries of that French Guarantor, provided that in such case such Note Guarantee shall be limited at any time: (A) to the payment obligations of such obligors and (B) to an amount equal to the aggregate of all amounts directly or indirectly (by way of intercompany loans or similar arrangements directly or indirectly from the Floating Rate SSN Issuer) received out of the proceeds of any offering of Floating Rate SSNs by such obligors and on-lent directly or indirectly to that French Guarantor and outstanding from time to time (the “Maximum _Guaranteed Amount”); any payment made by such French Guarantor under its Note Guarantee shall_ reduce pro tanto the outstanding amount of the intercompany loans or similar intercompany debt (if any) due by such French Guarantor to that party under the intercompany loan arrangements or similar arrangements referred to above. Notwithstanding any other provision of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, no French Guarantor shall secure liabilities under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSNs which would result in such French Guarantor not complying with French financial assistance rules as set out in Article L. 225-216 of the French _Code de Commerce and/or would constitute a misuse of corporate assets within the meaning of Article L. 241-3,_ L. 242-6 or L.244-1 of the French Code de Commerce or any other law or regulations having the same effect, as interpreted by French courts. For a description of such contractual limitations, see “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness and _the Notes—Corporate benefit, financial assistance laws and other limitations on the guarantees may adversely affect the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees of the Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes”._ Any payment made by such French Guarantor under its Note Guarantee will reduce the Maximum Guaranteed Amount of its Note Guarantee. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness and the _Notes—Corporate benefit, financial assistance laws and other limitations on the Guarantees may adversely affect the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees of the Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes”._ Assuming we had completed the Transactions and applied the net proceeds as intended, as of March 31, 2021, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors would have had pro forma total debt, which reflects external interest-bearing loans and borrowings (and excludes leases, bank guarantees and trade payables, social charges, employee profit-sharing, taxes and other similar payables), of €1,710 million, € million of which would have been represented by the Floating Rate SSNs. The operations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer are conducted through its Subsidiaries, and therefore the Floating Rate SSN Issuer depends on the cash flow of its Subsidiaries to meet its obligations, including its obligations under the Floating Rate SSNs. Not all of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s Subsidiaries will guarantee the Floating Rate SSNs. The Floating Rate SSNs will be effectively subordinated in right of payment to all Indebtedness and other liabilities and commitments (including trade payables and lease obligations) of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s non-guarantor Subsidiaries. Any right of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor to receive assets of any of its non-guarantor Subsidiaries upon that non-guarantor Subsidiary’s liquidation or reorganization (and the consequent right of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs to participate in those assets) will be effectively subordinated to the claims of that non-guarantor Subsidiary’s creditors, except to the extent that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor is itself recognized as a creditor of the non-guarantor Subsidiary, in which case the claims of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, as the case may be, would still be subordinated in right of payment to any security in the assets of the non-guarantor Subsidiary and any Indebtedness of the non-guarantor Subsidiary senior to that held by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor. As of March 31, 2021, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, including this offering of Floating Rate SSNs and the application of proceeds therefrom, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s non-guarantor Subsidiaries would have had no Indebtedness, excluding leases, bank guarantees and trade payables, social charges, employee profit-sharing, taxes and other similar payables. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness and the _Notes—Additional Risks Related to the Senior Secured Notes—The Senior Secured Notes will be structurally subordinated to the liabilities of non-guarantor subsidiaries”._ The Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors (other than the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer) also guarantee the Fixed Rate SSNs on a pari passu basis to their obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. In addition, the Note Guarantees provided by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and by Lion Polaris II are limited to an amount equal to the amount of all downstream intra-Group loans made available directly or indirectly to them or their respective subsidiaries with the proceeds of the Floating Rate SSNs (including the PG Intra Group Loan) and outstanding from time to time. However, under the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, 262 ----- the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs will need to share any recoveries from the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or Lion Polaris II with the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs. See “Description of Other Indebtedness—Intercreditor _Agreement—Equalization of the Senior Non Priority Debt creditors”. Furthermore, certain Restricted_ Subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Floating Rate SSNs guarantee or may guarantee one or more of the Revolving Credit Facility and certain Hedging Obligations (including a guarantee by Picard Surgelés S.A.S. under the Revolving Credit Facility).

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, each Floating Rate SSN Guarantor that provides a Note Guarantee, the Security Agent and the Floating Rate SSN Trustee will be authorized (without any further consent of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs) to enter into the Intercreditor Agreement to give effect to the provisions described in the section entitled “Description of Other Indebtedness— _Intercreditor Agreement”._ The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that each holder of the Floating Rate SSNs, by accepting such Floating Rate SSN, will be deemed to have: (1) appointed and authorized the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to give effect to the provisions in the Intercreditor Agreement; (2) agreed to be bound by the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement; and (3) irrevocably appointed the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to act on its behalf to enter into and comply with the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement. Please see the section entitled “Description of Other Indebtedness—Intercreditor Agreement”.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: On the Issue Date, the Floating Rate SSNs and/or the Note Guarantees will be secured by, subject to Permitted Collateral Liens, senior-ranking: (1) pledges of the following assets of the Senior Notes Issuer: the bank accounts of the Senior Notes Issuer in Luxembourg, the receivables under an intercompany loan by the Senior Notes Issuer and the ordinary shares of MidCo; (2) pledges of the following assets of MidCo: the bank accounts of MidCo in Luxembourg, the receivables under an intercompany loan by MidCo, the ordinary shares of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, one ordinary share of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and two ordinary shares of Lion Polaris II; (3) pledges of the following assets of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer: the bank accounts of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer in Luxembourg, the receivables under the PG Intra-Group Loan and another intercompany loan by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, one ordinary share of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and the ordinary shares of Lion Polaris II held by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer; (4) pledges of the following assets of Lion Polaris II: the bank accounts of Lion Polaris II in France, receivables under an intercompany loan by Lion Polaris II and the ordinary shares of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer held by Lion Polaris II; and (5) pledges of the following assets of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer: the bank accounts of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer in France, the receivables under an intercompany loan by the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, the ordinary shares of Picard Surgelés and the ordinary shares of Picard International S.A.S. The Collateral will also secure the obligations under the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Revolving Credit Facility, certain Hedging Obligations and other Indebtedness permitted by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture to be secured by the Collateral on a pari passu basis with the obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs, and, with respect to the Collateral other than the assets of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer and 264 ----- Lion Polaris II, will secure the obligations under the Senior Notes with junior priority ranking pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement. However, pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement, Holders of the Floating Rate SSNs will receive proceeds from enforcement of the Collateral and certain distressed disposals only after any obligations secured on a super-priority basis pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement, including obligations under the Revolving Credit Facility and certain Hedging Obligations, have been repaid in full. The Collateral will be granted pursuant to the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement to the Security Agent (i) on behalf of the holders of the secured obligations that are secured by the Collateral, including the Floating Rate SSNs or (ii) on its own behalf in its capacity as creditor of the parallel debt created under the Intercreditor Agreement in relation to, amongst others, the Floating Rate SSNs. In addition, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture will permit us to secure additional Indebtedness with the Collateral on a junior basis in accordance with the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement. For a discussion of the ranking of the Collateral and the application of the proceeds of the Collateral, see “Description of Other _Indebtedness—Intercreditor Agreement”._ The relative priority among (a) the lenders under the Revolving Credit Facility, (b) the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs, (c) the Fixed Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs, (d) the counterparties to certain Hedging Obligations and (e) the trustee under the Senior Notes Indenture and the holders of the Senior Notes with respect to the Liens on the Collateral that are created by the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents and secure obligations under the Floating Rate SSNs or the Note Guarantees and the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, will be established by the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, which provide that the obligations under the Revolving Credit Facility, the Floating Rate SSNs (subject to certain limitations described in more detail below), the Fixed Rate SSNs and certain Hedging Obligations are secured equally and ratably by, subject to Permitted Collateral Liens, a senior interest in the Collateral. However, pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement, Holders of the Floating Rate SSNs will receive proceeds from enforcement of the Collateral and certain distressed disposals only after any obligations secured on a super-priority basis, including obligations under the Revolving Credit Facility and certain Hedging Obligations, have been repaid in full. The holders of the Senior Notes have a junior priority interest in the Collateral (other than the assets of Lion Polaris II and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer). Furthermore, Liens over assets of Lion Polaris II and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer that secure the Floating Rate SSNs are limited to an amount equal to the amount of all downstream intra-Group loans made available directly or indirectly to them or their respective subsidiaries with the proceeds of the Floating Rate SSNs (including the PG Intra Group Loan) and outstanding from time to time. However, under the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the holders of the Fixed Rate SSNs will need to share any recoveries from the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or Lion Polaris II with the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs. See “Description of Other Indebtedness—Intercreditor Agreement—Equalization of the Senior Non Priority _Debt creditors”. Certain assets of the Restricted Subsidiaries that do not secure the Floating Rate SSNs may secure_ one or more of the Revolving Credit Facility and certain Hedging Obligations. Additionally, we may repay and cancel all or some of the intergroup loans that are pledged as Collateral (other than, in certain cases, the PG IntraGroup Loan) in the near future and we are not restricted from doing so by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents. The requirements for the granting of Liens under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, arising at any time on or after the Issue Date, will generally be subject to certain security principles described under “—Agreed Security _Principles”. In addition, the Liens on the Collateral will be subject to certain limitations and are at all times in all_ cases subject to the requirements of applicable law. Please see “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness _and the Notes—The insolvency and administrative laws of Luxembourg and France, as the case may be, may not be favorable to creditors, including investors in the Notes and may limit your ability to enforce your rights under the Notes, the Guarantees or the security interests in the Collateral” and “—The Senior Secured Notes, the Senior Notes, their Guarantees and the security interests in the Collateral may be declared unenforceable against third parties under fraudulent conveyance laws”._ The relevant pledgor and the Security Agent will enter into the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, which define the terms of security interests that secure the Floating Rate SSNs. The Collateral will secure the payment and performance when due of all of the obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and/or the relevant Floating Rate SSN Guarantor under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs or relevant Note Guarantee as provided in the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents. As of March 31, 2021, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, taken together with the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors and the Restricted Subsidiaries that are subject to share pledges, accounted for 99% of our EBITDA and 99% of our total assets (eliminating the value of shareholdings), in each case on a consolidated basis for the Senior Notes Issuer and its subsidiaries. So long as no Default or Event of Default has occurred and is continuing, and subject to certain terms and conditions, each pledgor will be entitled to receive all cash dividends, interest and other payments made upon or 265 ----- with respect to the shares pledged by it and to exercise any voting and other consensual rights pertaining to the shares pledged by it. The Floating Rate SSN Security Documents will provide that the Collateral may be enforced only upon an acceleration of the amounts due under the Floating Rate SSNs following an Event of Default. The Security Agent will enter into the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents in its own name for the benefit of, inter alios, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs. If any Collateral is granted to the Security Agent on its own behalf in its capacity as creditor of the parallel debt created under the Intercreditor Agreement in relation to the Floating Rate SSNs, then the rights of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs will not be directly secured by the Collateral under such Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, but through the parallel debt claim acknowledged by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer by way of an independent acknowledgement of Indebtedness to the Security Agent that is equal to the total amounts payable by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs. In either case, neither the Floating Rate SSN Trustee nor the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs may, individually or collectively, take any direct action to enforce any rights in their favor under the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents. The holders of the Floating Rate SSNs may only take action through the Security Agent. See “Risk _Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness and the Notes—The security interests in the Collateral will be granted to the relevant Security Agent rather than directly to the holders of the Senior Secured Notes or the Senior Notes. The holders of the Senior Secured Notes or the Senior Notes may not control certain decisions regarding the Collateral” and “—You may be required to pay a “soulte” in the event you decide to enforce the share pledges by judicial or contractual foreclosure of the Senior Secured Notes Collateral and the Senior Notes Collateral consisting of shares rather than by a sale of such Collateral in a public auction”._ The Security Agent will only be permitted to enforce the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents in accordance with instructions permitted to be given under the Intercreditor Agreement. For a description of security enforcement and other intercreditor provisions, please see “Description of Other Indebtedness— _Intercreditor Agreement”._ The Collateral will be released: (1) upon the full and final payment and performance of all obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSNs; (2) upon legal defeasance, covenant defeasance or satisfaction and discharge of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture as provided below under the captions “—Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance” and “—Satisfaction and Discharge”; (3) as described under “—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver” and “—Certain Covenants—Liens”; (4) as provided for under the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, including in connection with an enforcement sale; (5) in the case of Collateral owned by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, in connection with any sale or disposition of such property or assets (including in connection with any sale and leaseback transaction) to (a) any Person that is not the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary either before or after giving effect to such transaction or (b) to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary that is a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor; provided that such transfer is otherwise in compliance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and, in the case of clause (b), reasonably promptly following such sale or disposition, a Lien of at least equivalent ranking over the same assets or property exists or is granted in favor of the Security Agent (on its own behalf and on behalf of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee for the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs); (6) in the case of a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor that is released from its Note Guarantee pursuant to the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the release of the property and assets, and Capital Stock, of such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor; (7) if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer designates any Restricted Subsidiary to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the release of the property and assets and Capital Stock of such Restricted Subsidiary; (8) in order to effectuate a merger, consolidation, conveyance or transfer conducted in compliance with the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets”; provided that following such merger, consolidation, conveyance or transfer, a Lien of at least equivalent ranking over the same assets or property is granted in favor of the Security Agent (on its own behalf and on 266 ----- behalf of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee for the Holders) to the extent such assets or property continue to exist as assets or property of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary; (9) in accordance with “—Certain Covenants—Impairment of Security Interests”; (10) in connection with any Qualified Receivables Financing (which release shall be solely of Collateral constituting the Receivables Assets transferred (other than intercompany receivables)); (11) in connection with a Permitted Reorganization; or (12) in connection with any Post-Closing Merger, in which case the Collateral provided by the nonsurviving entity or entities will be released or assumed by the surviving entity, and if released may be released by the Security Agent on the basis only of an Officer’s Certificate, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Security Agent, stating that all conditions precedent and covenants, if any, provided for relating to the proposed Post-Closing Merger have been satisfied (without obtaining an Opinion of Counsel as to the satisfaction of such conditions precedent and covenants) as well as satisfaction of the conditions required under the Intercreditor Agreement (in particular the delivery of a non-distressed disposal certificate). The Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall have the right, in its sole discretion, by written notice to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent delivered prior to the automatic release of any Collateral as specified above, to (A) waive such automatic release of such Collateral and maintain such Collateral in effect until such time as the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall instruct and direct the Security Agent in writing to release such Collateral or (B) elect that the release of such Collateral shall not occur automatically as contemplated by the preceding paragraph but shall occur at such time or times, in such manner and order and upon the occurrence of such other events as shall be specified by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer in such notice to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent; provided further that nothing in this clause (B) shall allow the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to require the release of any Collateral prior to (unless such release and discharge is to occur substantially concurrently with) the occurrence of the applicable event(s) set forth in clauses (1) through (12) above providing for the release thereof. The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that any release of a Lien on Collateral may, at the request of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, be evidenced by the delivery by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent of an Officer’s Certificate of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, and that the Security Agent shall acknowledge and confirm such release upon delivery of such Officer’s Certificate certifying which circumstance, as set forth above, giving rise to a release of the security interests over the Collateral has occurred and that such release complies with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and (other than in connection with a Post-Closing Merger as described in clause (12) above) an opinion of counsel.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that certain requirements for the granting of Liens (other than Liens with respect to the Collateral securing, or purporting to secure, the Floating Rate SSNs on the Issue Date) in favor of the Floating Rate SSNs will generally be subject to the following security principles (the “Agreed _Security Principles”), which will provide that no Lien will be required to be created or perfected, as applicable,_ by any person: (1) if providing such security (x) could reasonably be expected to give rise to or result in (i) any violation of applicable law that cannot be avoided or otherwise prevented through measures reasonably available to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or its Restricted Subsidiaries or such other Person, including that would be prohibited by statutory limitations, corporate benefit, financial assistance, fraudulent preference, thin capitalization rules, transfer pricing rules, capital maintenance rules, misuse of corporate assets, guidance and coordination rules or the laws rules or regulations (or analogous restriction) of any applicable jurisdiction (after the use of reasonable endeavors to overcome the relevant legal limitation, if possible) or (ii) any risk or liability to the officers, directors or shareholders of the relevant grantor of security and/or guarantee, whether civil or criminal liability or (y) would be outside the applicable pledgor’s capacity or result in a breach of its fiduciary duties, in each case, which cannot be avoided or otherwise prevented through measures reasonably available to such officers, directors or shareholders; (2) (a) if the cost of providing security is disproportionate to the benefit obtained by the Holders of such security or guarantee thereof or (b) if such Lien could reasonably be expected to give rise to or result in any significant cost, expense, liability or obligation other than reasonable out-of-pocket expenses and 267 ----- other than reasonable expenses incurred in connection with any governmental or regulatory filings required as a result of, or any measures pursuant to clause (1) above undertaken in connection with, such Lien or guarantee thereof, which cannot be avoided through measures reasonably available to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or its Restricted Subsidiaries or such other Person; (3) if there is material incremental cost involved in creating security over all assets of a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor in a particular category of assets, only the material assets in that category will be subject to security; (4) if any assets (other than shares of existing or future obligors under the Revolving Credit Facility or intragroup receivables between existing obligors under the Revolving Credit Facility) are subject to third party arrangements which prevent those assets from being secured without consent or where providing such security would give a third party the right to terminate or otherwise amend to the material detriment of the security providers any rights, benefits and/or obligations of the security providers, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s Subsidiaries in respect of those assets or require any of them to take any action materially adverse to their interests; _provided that, for such assets which are situated in a jurisdiction where there is already Collateral,_ reasonable endeavors to obtain consent to securing any such assets shall be used by the relevant pledgor if the relevant asset is material; (5) in respect of perfection actions only, in jurisdictions where a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor is not located or if such perfection action would have a material adverse effect on the ability of the relevant pledgor to conduct its operations and business in the ordinary course as otherwise permitted by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; and (6) in respect of the grant of security, over certain categories of assets in jurisdictions where it is either impossible or impractical to create such security. Each Lien will also be limited as necessary to recognize certain defenses generally available to grantors of Liens (including those that relate to fraudulent conveyance or transfer, voidable preference, financial assistance, corporate purpose, misuse of corporate assets, capital maintenance or similar laws, regulations or defenses affecting the rights of creditors generally) or other considerations under applicable law.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: At any time prior to, 2022, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may on any one or more occasions redeem all or a part of the Floating Rate SSNs upon not less than 10 nor more than 60 days’ notice, at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs redeemed, plus the Applicable Premium as of, and accrued and unpaid interest and Additional Amounts, if any, to the date of redemption, subject to the rights of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date. Except pursuant to the preceding paragraph and except pursuant to “—Optional Redemption upon Certain _Tender Offers” and “—Redemption for Changes in Taxes”, the Floating Rate SSNs will not be redeemable at the_ Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s option prior to, 2022. On or after, 2022, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may on any one or more occasions redeem all or a part of the Floating Rate SSNs upon not less than 10 nor more than 60 days’ notice, at the redemption prices (expressed as percentages of principal amount) set forth below, plus accrued and unpaid interest and Additional Amounts, if any, on the Floating Rate SSNs redeemed, to the applicable date of redemption, if redeemed during the twelve-month period beginning on of the years indicated below, subject to the rights of holders of Floating Rate SSNs on the relevant record date to receive interest on the relevant interest payment date:

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Optional Redemption upon Certain Tender Offers
Subsubsection Text: In connection with any tender offer for, or other offer to purchase, all of the Floating Rate SSNs (including with respect to a Change of Control Offer), in the event that holders of not less than 90% of the aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs validly tender and do not validly withdraw such Floating Rate SSNs in such tender offer or offer to purchase and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a third party making such tender offer or offer to purchase purchases all the Floating Rate SSNs held by such holders, within 60 days of such purchase, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will have the right, upon not less than 10 and no more than 60 days’ prior notice, to redeem all (but not less than all) the Floating Rate SSNs that remain outstanding following such purchase at a redemption price equal to the highest price (excluding any early tender premium or similar payment and accrued and unpaid interest) paid to each other holder in such tender offer or offer to purchase, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon, to, but excluding, the date of such redemption (subject to the right of Holders of record on a record date to receive interest on the relevant interest payment date).

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: 2022 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 101.00% 2023 and thereafter . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 100.00% Unless the Floating Rate SSN Issuer defaults in the payment of the redemption price, interest will cease to accrue on the Floating Rate SSNs or portions thereof called for redemption on the applicable redemption date. Any redemption or notice may, in the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s discretion, be subject to the satisfaction of one or more conditions precedent. 268 ----- The Floating Rate SSN Issuer or its Affiliates may repurchase Floating Rate SSNs at any time and from time to time in the open market, in privately negotiated transactions, pursuant to one or more tender or exchange offers or otherwise, upon such terms and with such consideration as the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any such Affiliate may determine.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer may redeem the Floating Rate SSNs, in whole but not in part, at its discretion at any time upon giving not less than 10 nor more than 60 days’ prior notice to the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs (which notice will be irrevocable and given in accordance with the procedures described in “—Selection _and Notice”), at a redemption price equal to 100% of the aggregate principal amount thereof, together with_ accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to the date fixed by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer for redemption (a “Tax _Redemption Date”) and all Additional Amounts (if any) then due and which will become due on the Tax_ Redemption Date as a result of the redemption or otherwise (subject to the right of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date and Additional Amounts (if any) in respect thereof), if on the next date on which any amount would be payable in respect of the Floating Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer under or with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs or any of the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors with respect to any Note Guarantee, as the case may be, is or would be required to pay Additional Amounts, and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer cannot avoid any such payment obligation by taking reasonable measures available (including, for the avoidance of doubt, the appointment of a new Floating Rate SSN Paying Agent in accordance with the provisions under the heading “—Paying Agent and Registrar for the Floating Rate SSNs” or, in respect of a payment under a Note Guarantee, payment through another Floating Rate SSN Guarantor (other than the Senior Notes Issuer) or the Floating Rate SSN Issuer), and the requirement arises as a result of: (1) any amendment to, or change in, the laws or treaties or any regulations or rulings promulgated thereunder of a relevant Tax Jurisdiction which change or amendment becomes effective on or after the date of this offering memorandum (or, if the applicable Tax Jurisdiction became a Tax Jurisdiction on a date after the date of this offering memorandum, such later date) and which was not publicly and formally announced or publicly and formally proposed, in substantially the form as enacted, prior to the date of this offering memorandum; or (2) any amendment to, or change in, an official written interpretation or application of such laws, treaties, regulations or rulings (including by virtue of a holding, judgment, order by a court of competent jurisdiction or a change in published administrative practice) which amendment or change becomes effective on or after the date of this offering memorandum (or, if the applicable Tax Jurisdiction became a Tax Jurisdiction on a date after the date of this offering memorandum, such later date) and which was not publicly and formally announced or publicly and formally proposed, in substantially the form as enacted, prior to the date of this offering memorandum (each of the foregoing clauses (1) and (2), a “Change in Tax Law”). The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not give any such notice of redemption earlier than 90 days prior to the earliest date on which the Floating Rate SSN Issuer would be obligated to make such payment or withholding if a payment in respect of the Floating Rate SSNs were then due, and the obligation to pay Additional Amounts must be in effect at the time such notice is given. Prior to the publication or, where relevant, mailing of any notice of redemption of the Floating Rate SSNs pursuant to the foregoing, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee an opinion of independent tax counsel (the choice of such counsel to be subject to the 269 ----- prior written approval of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld)) to the effect that there has been such Change in Tax Law which would entitle the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to redeem the Floating Rate SSNs hereunder. In addition, before the Floating Rate SSN Issuer publishes or mails notice of redemption of the Floating Rate SSNs as described above, it will deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Floating Rate SSN Principal Paying Agent an Officer’s Certificate to the effect that it cannot avoid its obligation to pay Additional Amounts by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer taking reasonable measures available to it. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee will accept and shall be entitled to rely on such Officer’s Certificate and opinion of counsel as sufficient evidence of the existence and satisfaction of the conditions precedent as described above, in which event it will be conclusive and binding on the holders. The foregoing provisions shall apply (a) to a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor only after such time as such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor is obligated to make at least one payment on the Floating Rate SSNs and (b) mutatis mutandis to any successor Person, after such successor Person becomes a party to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, with respect to a Change in Tax Law occurring after the time such successor Person becomes a party to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer is not required to make mandatory redemption or sinking fund payments with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: Repurchase at the Option of Holders
Subsubsection Text: If a Change of Control occurs, each holder of Floating Rate SSNs will have the right to require the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to repurchase all or any part (equal to €100,000 or an integral multiple of €1,000 in excess thereof) of that holder’s Floating Rate SSNs pursuant to a Change of Control Offer on the terms set forth in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. In the Change of Control Offer, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will offer a payment in cash equal to 101% of the aggregate principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs repurchased, plus accrued and unpaid interest and Additional Amounts, if any, on the Floating Rate SSNs repurchased to the date of purchase (the “Change of Control Payment”), subject to the rights of holders of Floating Rate SSNs on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date. Unless the Floating Rate SSN Issuer has unconditionally exercised its right to redeem all the Floating Rate SSNs as described under “—Optional Redemption” or all conditions to such redemption have been satisfied or waived, within 60 days following any Change of Control, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will mail a notice (the “Change of Control Offer”), copied to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, to each holder of the Floating Rate SSNs at such holder’s registered address or otherwise deliver a notice in accordance with the procedures described under “—Selection and Notice”, stating that a Change of Control Offer is being made and offering to repurchase Floating Rate SSNs on the date (the “Change of Control Payment Date”) specified in the notice, which date will be no earlier than 10 days and no later than 60 days from the date such notice is mailed or delivered, pursuant to the procedures required by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and described in such notice. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will comply, to the extent applicable, with the requirements of Rule 14e-1 under the U.S. Exchange Act and any other applicable securities laws and regulations, including administrative interpretations thereof (including, for the avoidance of doubt, no-action letters issued by the Commission indicating that the staff of the Commission will not recommend enforcement action in the event a tender offer satisfies certain conditions), to the extent those laws and regulations are applicable in connection with the repurchase of the Floating Rate SSNs as a result of a Change of Control Offer. To the extent that the provisions of any securities laws or regulations conflict with the Change of Control provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will comply with any applicable securities laws and regulations and will not be deemed to have breached its obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture by virtue of such compliance. On the Change of Control Payment Date, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will, to the extent lawful: (1) accept for payment all Floating Rate SSNs or portions (equal to €100,000 aggregate principal amount and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof) of Floating Rate SSNs properly tendered pursuant to the Change of Control Offer; (2) deposit with the Floating Rate SSN Principal Paying Agent an amount equal to the Change of Control Payment in respect of all Floating Rate SSNs or portions of Floating Rate SSNs properly tendered; and 270 ----- (3) deliver or cause to be delivered to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee the Floating Rate SSNs properly accepted together with an Officer’s Certificate stating the aggregate principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs or portions of Floating Rate SSNs being purchased by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer. The Floating Rate SSN Principal Paying Agent will promptly mail (or cause to be delivered) to each holder of Floating Rate SSNs properly tendered the Change of Control Payment for such Floating Rate SSNs, and the Floating Rate SSN Trustee (or its authenticating agent) will promptly, upon receipt of an authentication order from the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, authenticate and mail (or cause to be transferred by book-entry) to each holder a new Floating Rate SSN equal in principal amount to any unpurchased portion of the Floating Rate SSNs surrendered, if any; provided that each such new Floating Rate SSN will be in an aggregate principal amount that is at least €100,000 and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will publicly announce the results of the Change of Control Offer on or as soon as practicable after the Change of Control Payment Date. The provisions described above that require the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to make a Change of Control Offer following a Change of Control will be applicable whether or not any other provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture are applicable. Except as described above with respect to a Change of Control, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture will not contain provisions that permit the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs to require that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer repurchase or redeem the Floating Rate SSNs in the event of a takeover, recapitalization or similar transaction. The existence of a holder of the Floating Rate SSNs’ right to require the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to repurchase such holder’s Floating Rate SSNs upon the occurrence of a Change of Control may deter a third party from seeking to acquire the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or its Subsidiaries in a transaction that would constitute a Change of Control. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not be required to make a Change of Control Offer upon a Change of Control if (1) a third party makes the Change of Control Offer in the manner, at the times and otherwise in compliance with the requirements set forth in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture applicable to a Change of Control Offer made by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and purchases all Floating Rate SSNs properly tendered and not withdrawn under the Change of Control Offer, or (2) a notice of redemption has been given pursuant to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture as described above under the caption “—Optional Redemption” unless and until there is a default in payment of the applicable redemption price. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, a Change of Control Offer may be made in advance of a Change of Control, conditioned upon the consummation of such Change of Control, if a definitive agreement is in place for the Change of Control at the time the Change of Control Offer is made. In addition, the definitions of “Change of Control” and “Permitted Holders” expressly permit a third party to obtain control of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer in a transaction which is a Specified Change of Control Event without any obligation to make a Change of Control Offer. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s ability to repurchase Floating Rate SSNs pursuant to a Change of Control Offer following the occurrence of a Change of Control may be limited by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s then existing financial resources. There can be no assurance that sufficient funds will be available when necessary to make the required purchase of the Floating Rate SSNs. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness _and the Notes—We may not be able to finance a change of control offer and certain transactions will not require us to make a change of control offer”._ The definition of Change of Control includes a phrase relating to the direct or indirect sale, lease, transfer, conveyance or other disposition of “all or substantially all” of the properties or assets of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries taken as a whole. Although there is a limited body of case law interpreting the phrase “substantially all,” there is no precise established definition of the phrase under applicable law. Accordingly, the ability of a holder of Floating Rate SSNs to require the Floating Rate SSN Issuer to repurchase its Floating Rate SSNs as a result of a sale, lease, transfer, conveyance or other disposition of less than all of the assets of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries taken as a whole to another Person or group may be uncertain. The provisions under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture relating to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s obligation to make an offer to repurchase the Floating Rate SSNs as a result of a Change of Control may be waived or modified with the consent of the holders of a majority in principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs prior to the occurrence of the Change of Control. 271 ----- If and for so long as the Floating Rate SSNs are listed on the Official List of the Exchange and admitted for trading on the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange so require, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will notify the Exchange of any Change of Control Offer.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: Repurchase at the Option of Holders
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not, and will not cause or permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries to, directly or indirectly, consummate an Asset Sale unless: (1) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer (or the Restricted Subsidiary, as the case may be) receives consideration at the time of the Asset Sale at least equal to the Fair Market Value of the assets or Equity Interests issued or sold or otherwise disposed of; and (2) (except to the extent the Asset Disposition is a Permitted Asset Swap) at least 75% of the consideration received in the Asset Sale by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Restricted Subsidiary is in the form of cash, Cash Equivalents or Temporary Cash Investments. For purposes of this provision, each of the following will be deemed to be cash: (a) any liabilities, as recorded on the balance sheet of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary (other than contingent liabilities and liabilities that are by their terms subordinated to the Floating Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee), that are assumed by the transferee of any such assets and as a result of which the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries are no longer obligated with respect to such liabilities or are indemnified against further liabilities; (b) any securities, notes or other obligations received by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any such Restricted Subsidiary from such transferee that are converted by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Restricted Subsidiary into cash, Cash Equivalents or Temporary Cash Investments within 180 days following the closing of the Asset Sale, to the extent of the cash, Cash Equivalents or Temporary Cash Investments received in that conversion; (c) any Capital Stock or assets of the kind referred to in clauses (1)(c) or (e) of the next paragraph of this covenant; (d) any Designated Non-Cash Consideration received by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary in such Asset Sales having an aggregate Fair Market Value, taken together with all other Designated Non-Cash Consideration received pursuant to this clause (d) that is at that time outstanding, not to exceed the greater of €50.0 million and 15.0% of Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer at the time of the receipt of such Designated Non-Cash Consideration (with the Fair Market Value of each item of Designated Non-Cash Consideration being measured at the time received and without giving effect to subsequent changes in value); (e) Indebtedness of any Restricted Subsidiary that is no longer a Restricted Subsidiary as a result of such Asset Sale, to the extent that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and each other Restricted Subsidiary are released from any guarantee of such Indebtedness in connection with such Asset Sale; and (f) consideration consisting of Indebtedness of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary received from Persons who are not the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary. Within 365 days after the receipt of any Net Proceeds from an Asset Sale, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer (or the applicable Restricted Subsidiary, as the case may be) may: (1) apply such Net Proceeds (at the option of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or Restricted Subsidiary): (a) (i) to prepay, repay, purchase or redeem any Indebtedness Incurred under clause (1) of the second paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Incurrence of Indebtedness _and Issuance of Preferred Stock”; or (ii) unless included in (a)(i), to prepay, repay, purchase or_ redeem Floating Rate SSNs and Senior Secured Indebtedness (including by way of an Asset Sale Offer); provided that, in the case of (a)(ii), if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary shall so reduce Obligations constituting Senior Secured Indebtedness other than the Floating Rate SSNs, such prepayment, repayment, purchase or redemption shall be at a price of no more than 100% of the principal amount of such Senior Secured Indebtedness plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts to the date of prepayment, repayment, purchase or redemption and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will at least equally and ratably reduce Obligations under the Floating Rate SSNs through open-market purchases or by making an offer to all holders 272 ----- to purchase at a purchase price equal to at least 100% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, for at least the pro rata amount of the Floating Rate SSNs; provided further, that in each case under this clause (a), such Floating Rate SSNs and Senior Secured Indebtedness shall be other than Indebtedness owed to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or an Affiliate of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer; (b) to purchase or prepay or redeem or repay (i) any Indebtedness that is secured by a Lien on assets or property which do not constitute Collateral or (ii) any Indebtedness of a Restricted Subsidiary that is not a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor; (c) to acquire all or substantially all of the assets of, or any Capital Stock of, another Permitted Business, if, after giving effect to any such acquisition of Capital Stock, the Permitted Business is or becomes a Restricted Subsidiary; (d) to make a capital expenditure; (e) to acquire other assets (other than Capital Stock) not classified as current assets under IFRS that are used or useful in a Permitted Business; or (f) any combination of the foregoing; or (2) enter into a binding commitment to apply the Net Proceeds pursuant to clause (a), (c), (d) or (e) of paragraph (1) above; provided that such binding commitment shall be treated as a permitted application of the Net Proceeds from the date of such commitment until the earlier of (x) the date on which such acquisition or expenditure is consummated, and (y) the 180[th] day following the expiration of the aforementioned 365-day period. If Net Proceeds from an Asset Sale are applied to prepay, repay, purchase or redeem any Indebtedness pursuant to the preceding paragraph, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall be required to retire such Indebtedness or cause the related commitments to be permanently reduced, except in the case of revolving Indebtedness. Pending the final application of any Net Proceeds, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer (or the applicable Restricted Subsidiary) may temporarily reduce revolving credit borrowings or otherwise use the Net Proceeds in any manner that is not prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. Any Net Proceeds from Asset Sales that are not applied or invested as provided in the second paragraph of this covenant will constitute “Excess Proceeds”. When the aggregate amount of Excess Proceeds exceeds the greater of €20.0 million and 6% of Consolidated EBITDA, within ten Business Days thereof, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will make an offer (an “Asset Sale Offer”) to all holders of Floating Rate SSNs, copied to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, and, to the extent the Floating Rate SSN Issuer elects, to all holders of other Indebtedness that is pari passu with the Floating Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee, to purchase, prepay or redeem the maximum principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs and such other pari passu Indebtedness (plus all accrued interest on the Indebtedness and the amount of all fees and expenses, including premiums and additional amounts, incurred in connection therewith) that may be purchased, prepaid or redeemed out of the Excess Proceeds. The offer price for the Floating Rate SSNs in any Asset Sale Offer will be equal to at least 100% of the principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest and Additional Amounts, if any, to the date of purchase, prepayment or redemption, subject to the rights of holders of Floating Rate SSNs on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date, and will be payable in cash. If any Excess Proceeds remain after consummation of an Asset Sale Offer, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may use those Excess Proceeds for any purpose not otherwise prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. If the aggregate principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs and other pari passu Indebtedness tendered into (or to be prepaid or redeemed in connection with) such Asset Sale Offer exceeds the amount of Excess Proceeds or if the aggregate amount of Floating Rate SSNs tendered pursuant to an Asset Sale Offer exceeds the amount of the Net Proceeds so applied, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or Floating Rate SSN Registrar will select the Floating Rate SSNs and such other pari passu Indebtedness, if applicable, to be purchased on a pro rata basis (or in the manner described under “—Selection _and Notice”), based on the amounts tendered or required to be prepaid or redeemed. Upon completion of each_ Asset Sale Offer, the amount of Excess Proceeds will be reset at zero. Neither the Floating Rate SSN Trustee nor the Floating Rate SSN Registrar shall be liable for any selection made in accordance with this paragraph. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, as the case may be, may make an Asset Sale Offer prior to the expiration of the 365-day period mentioned above. To the extent that any portion of Net Proceeds payable in respect of the Floating Rate SSNs is denominated in a currency other than euro, the amount thereof payable in respect of such Floating Rate SSNs shall not exceed 273 ----- the net amount of funds in euro that is actually received by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer upon converting such portion of the Net Proceeds into euro. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will comply, to the extent applicable, with the requirements of Rule 14e-1 under the U.S. Exchange Act and any other applicable securities laws and regulations, including administrative interpretations thereof (including, for the avoidance of doubt, no-action letters issued by the Commission indicating that the staff of the Commission will not recommend enforcement action in the event a tender offer satisfies certain conditions), to the extent those laws and regulations are applicable in connection with each repurchase of Floating Rate SSNs pursuant to a Change of Control Offer or an Asset Sale Offer. To the extent that the provisions of any securities laws or regulations conflict with, or are more favorable and/or less onerous to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer than, the Change of Control or Asset Sale provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will comply with the applicable securities laws and regulations and will not be deemed to have breached its obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture by virtue of such compliance.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: If less than all of the Floating Rate SSNs are to be redeemed at any time, Euroclear and Clearstream will credit their respective participants’ accounts on a proportionate basis by use of a pool factor (with adjustments to prevent fractions) and in compliance with their respective requirements and procedures or on such other basis as they deem fair and appropriate unless otherwise required by law or applicable stock exchange or depository requirements. None of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, the Floating Rate SSN Paying Agent nor the Floating Rate SSN Registrar shall be liable for selections made by it in accordance with this paragraph. No Floating Rate SSNs of €100,000 or less can be redeemed in part. Notices of redemption will be mailed by first class mail at least 10 but not more than 60 days before the redemption date to each holder of Floating Rate SSNs to be redeemed at its registered address, except that redemption notices may be mailed more than 60 days prior to a redemption date if the notice is issued in connection with a defeasance of the Floating Rate SSNs or a satisfaction and discharge of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. Notice of any redemption of the Floating Rate SSNs may, at the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s discretion, be given prior to the completion of a transaction (including an Equity Offering, an Incurrence of Indebtedness, a Change of Control or other transaction) and any redemption notice may, at the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s discretion, be subject to one or more conditions precedent, including, but not limited to, completion of a related transaction. If such redemption or purchase is so subject to satisfaction of one or more conditions precedent, such notice shall describe each such condition, and if applicable, shall state that, in the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s discretion, the redemption date may be delayed until such time (but not more than 60 days after the date the notice of redemption was sent) as any or all such conditions shall be satisfied, or such redemption or purchase may not occur and such notice may be rescinded in the event that any or all such conditions shall not have been satisfied by the redemption date, or by the redemption date as so delayed. In addition, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may provide in such notice that payment of the redemption price and performance of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s obligations with respect to such redemption may be performed by another Person. If any Floating Rate SSN is to be redeemed in part only, the notice of redemption that relates to that Floating Rate SSN will state the portion of the principal amount of that Floating Rate SSN that is to be redeemed. A new Floating Rate SSN in principal amount equal to the unredeemed portion of the original Floating Rate SSN will be issued in the name of the holder of Floating Rate SSNs upon cancellation of the original Floating Rate SSN. In the case of a Global Note, redemption will be effected in accordance with the procedures of the relevant clearing system or by making an appropriate notation on such Floating Rate SSN to decrease the principal amount thereof to an amount equal to the unredeemed portion thereof. Floating Rate SSNs called for redemption become due on the date fixed for redemption. On and after the redemption date, interest ceases to accrue on Floating Rate SSNs or portions of Floating Rate SSNs called for redemption. For Floating Rate SSNs which are represented by global certificates held on behalf of Euroclear or Clearstream, notices may be given by delivery of the relevant notices to Euroclear or Clearstream, for communication to entitled account holders in substitution for the aforesaid mailing. So long as any Floating Rate SSNs are listed on the Official List of the Exchange and admitted for trading on the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange so require, any such notice to the holders of the relevant Floating Rate SSNs shall, to the extent and in the manner permitted by such rules, be posted on the official website of the Exchange and, in connection with any redemption, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will notify the Exchange of any change in the principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs outstanding. 274 ----- If requested in writing by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, which request may be included in the applicable notice of redemption or pursuant to the applicable Officer’s Certificate, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the Floating Rate SSN Paying Agent (or such other entity directed, designated or appointed (as agent) by the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, for this purpose) shall distribute any amounts deposited to the holders prior to the applicable redemption date; provided, however, that holders shall have received at least three Business Days’ notice from the Floating Rate SSN Issuer of such earlier repayment (which may be included in the notice of redemption). For the avoidance of doubt, the distribution and payment to holders prior to the applicable redemption date as set forth above will not include any negative interest, present value adjustment, break costs or any other premium on such amounts. To the extent the Floating Rate SSNs are represented by a Global Note, any payment to the beneficial holders holding Book-Entry Interests will be subject to the then applicable procedures of Euroclear and/or Clearstream. For the avoidance of doubt, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Floating Rate SSN Paying Agent shall not be liable to any party for any reason as a result of such amounts being distributed to holders prior to any applicable redemption date.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Preferred Stock
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not, and will not cause or permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries to, directly or indirectly, Incur any Indebtedness (including Acquired Debt), and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not issue any Disqualified Stock and will not permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries to issue any shares of Preferred Stock; provided, however, that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may Incur Indebtedness (including Acquired Debt) or issue Disqualified Stock, and the Restricted Subsidiaries may Incur Indebtedness (including Acquired Debt), issue Disqualified Stock or issue Preferred Stock, if the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio for the Senior Notes Issuer’s most recently ended four full fiscal quarters for which internal financial statements are available immediately preceding the date on which such additional Indebtedness is Incurred or such Disqualified Stock or such Preferred Stock is issued, as the case may be, would have been at least 2.00 to 1.00 determined on a pro forma basis (including a pro forma application of the net proceeds therefrom), as if the additional Indebtedness had been Incurred or the Disqualified Stock or the Preferred Stock had been issued, as the case may be, and the application of proceeds therefrom had occurred at the beginning of such four-quarter period. The first paragraph of this covenant will not prohibit the Incurrence of any of the following items of Indebtedness (collectively, “Permitted Debt”): (1) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries of additional Indebtedness under Credit Facilities in an aggregate principal amount at any one time outstanding under this clause (1) not to exceed the greater of €95.0 million and 30% of Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer, provided, that any Indebtedness Incurred pursuant to this clause (1) may be refinanced at any time if such refinancing does not exceed the greater of (i) the aggregate principal amount of Indebtedness permitted to be Incurred pursuant to this clause (1) on the date of such refinancing or on the date as determined under “—Financial Calculations,” as applicable, and (ii) the aggregate principal amount of the Indebtedness being refinanced at such time; (2) Indebtedness of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary outstanding on the Issue Date after giving effect to the use of proceeds of the Floating Rate SSNs, including the Fixed Rate SSNs and the guarantees of the Fixed Rate SSNs and the Senior Notes issued on the Issue Date; (3) (i) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors of Indebtedness represented by the Floating Rate SSNs issued on the Issue Date and the related Note Guarantees and (ii) any “parallel debt” obligations under the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement and the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (4) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Indebtedness represented by Capital Lease Obligations, mortgage financings, purchase money obligations or other financings, in each case, Incurred for the purpose of financing all or any part of the purchase price or cost of design, construction, installation or improvement of property (real or personal), plant or equipment (whether through the direct purchase of assets or the Capital Stock of any Person owning such assets) used in the business of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries, in an aggregate principal amount, including all Permitted Refinancing Indebtedness Incurred to renew, refund, refinance, replace, defease or discharge any Indebtedness Incurred pursuant to this clause (4), not to exceed the greater of €45.0 million and 14% of Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer at any time outstanding; 275 ----- (5) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Permitted Refinancing Indebtedness in exchange for, or the net proceeds of which are used to renew, refund, refinance, replace, defease or discharge any Indebtedness (other than intercompany Indebtedness) that was permitted by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture to be Incurred under (a) the first paragraph of this covenant or (b) clauses (2), (3), (5) or (17) of this paragraph; (6) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary of intercompany Indebtedness between or among the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary; provided that: (a) if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor is the obligor on such Indebtedness and the payee is not the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, such Indebtedness must be unsecured and expressly subordinated to the prior payment in full in cash of all Obligations then due with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs, in the case of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, or the Note Guarantee, in the case of a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor (i) except in respect of Working Capital Intercompany Loans, (ii) only to the extent legally permitted (the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Restricted Subsidiaries having completed all procedures required in the reasonable judgment of directors or officers of the obligee or obligor to protect such persons from any penalty or civil or criminal liability in connection with the subordination of such Indebtedness) and (iii) only if and to the extent required by the Intercreditor Agreement; and (b) (i) any subsequent issuance or transfer of Equity Interests that results in any such Indebtedness being held by a Person other than the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary and (ii) any sale or other transfer of any such Indebtedness to a Person that is not either the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, will be deemed, in each case, to constitute an Incurrence of such Indebtedness by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Restricted Subsidiary, as the case may be, that is not permitted by this clause (6); (7) the issuance by any Restricted Subsidiary to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or to any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Preferred Stock; provided that: (a) any subsequent issuance or transfer of Equity Interests that results in any such Preferred Stock being held by a Person other than the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary; and (b) any sale or other transfer of any such Preferred Stock to a Person that is not either the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary, will be deemed, in each case, to constitute an issuance of such Preferred Stock by such Restricted Subsidiary that is not permitted by this clause (7); (8) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary of Hedging Obligations for bona fide hedging purposes of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries and not for speculative purposes; (9) the guarantee by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary of Indebtedness of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary to the extent that the guaranteed Indebtedness was permitted to be Incurred by another provision of this covenant; provided that if the Indebtedness being guaranteed is subordinated to the Floating Rate SSNs or a Note Guarantee, then the guarantee must be subordinated to the same extent as the Indebtedness guaranteed; (10) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Indebtedness in respect of workers’ compensation claims, self-insurance obligations, captive insurance companies, bankers’ acceptances, performance and surety bonds in the ordinary course of business or consistent with past practice; (11) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries of Indebtedness arising from the honoring by a bank or other financial institution of a check, draft or similar instrument inadvertently drawn against insufficient funds, so long as such Indebtedness is covered within 30 days of such Incurrence; (12) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries of Indebtedness arising from agreements of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary providing for customary indemnification, obligations in respect of earnouts or other adjustments of purchase price or, in each case, similar obligations, in each case, Incurred or assumed in connection with the acquisition or disposition of any business or assets or Person or any Equity Interests of a Subsidiary, provided that the maximum liability of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries in respect of all such 276 ----- Indebtedness in connection with any disposition shall at no time exceed the gross proceeds, including the Fair Market Value of non-cash proceeds (measured at the time received and without giving effect to any subsequent changes in value), actually received by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries in connection with such disposition; (13) the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries of Indebtedness in respect of (A) letters of credit, surety, performance or appeal bonds, completion guarantees, judgment, advance payment, customs, VAT or other tax guarantees or similar instruments issued in the ordinary course of business of such Person and not in connection with the borrowing of money, including letters of credit or similar instruments in respect of self-insurance and workers compensation obligations, and (B) any customary cash management, cash pooling or netting or setting off arrangements; provided, _however, that upon the drawing of such letters of credit or other instrument, such obligations are_ reimbursed within 60 days following such drawing; (14) Indebtedness of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries in respect of Management Advances; (15) customer deposits and advance payments received in the ordinary course of business from customers for goods and services purchased in the ordinary course of business (including with respect to franchisees);
