(18) any Permitted Reorganization or Post-Closing Merger; and (19) any participation in public tender or exchange offers for securities or debt instruments issued by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries that are conducted on arm’s-length terms and provide for the same price or exchange ratio, as the case may be, to all holders accepting such tender or exchange offer. 292 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Designation of Restricted and Unrestricted Subsidiaries
Subsubsection Text: The Board of Directors of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may designate any Restricted Subsidiary (including any newly acquired or newly formed Restricted Subsidiary) to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary if that designation would not cause a Default. If a Restricted Subsidiary is designated as an Unrestricted Subsidiary, the aggregate Fair Market Value of all outstanding Investments owned by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries in the Subsidiary designated as an Unrestricted Subsidiary will be deemed to be an Investment made as of the time of the designation and will reduce the amount available for Restricted Payments under the covenant described above under the caption “—Restricted Payments” or under one or more clauses of the definition of Permitted Investments, as determined by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer. That designation will only be permitted if the Investment would be permitted at that time and if the Restricted Subsidiary otherwise meets the definition of an Unrestricted Subsidiary. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer may redesignate any Unrestricted Subsidiary to be a Restricted Subsidiary if that redesignation would not cause a Default. Any designation of a Subsidiary of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer as an Unrestricted Subsidiary will be evidenced to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee by filing with the Floating Rate SSN Trustee a copy of a resolution of the Board of Directors giving effect to such designation and an Officer’s Certificate certifying that such designation complied with the preceding conditions and was permitted by the covenant described above under the caption “—Restricted _Payments”. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee will be entitled to conclusively rely upon such Officer’s Certificate_ and resolution copy, without independent verification. The Board of Directors of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may at any time designate any Unrestricted Subsidiary to be a Restricted Subsidiary; provided that such designation will be deemed to be an Incurrence of Indebtedness by a Restricted Subsidiary of any outstanding Indebtedness of such Unrestricted Subsidiary, and such designation will only be permitted if (1) such Indebtedness is permitted under the covenant described under the caption “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and _Issuance of Preferred Stock”, calculated on a pro forma basis as if such designation had occurred at the_ beginning of the applicable reference period; and (2) no Default or Event of Default would be in existence following such designation.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will use its commercially reasonable efforts to obtain and maintain the listing of the Floating Rate SSNs on the Exchange for so long as such Floating Rate SSNs are outstanding; provided that if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer is unable to obtain admission to listing of the Floating Rate SSNs on the Exchange or if at any time the Floating Rate SSN Issuer determines that it will not maintain such listing, it will use its commercially reasonable efforts to obtain and maintain a listing of such Floating Rate SSNs on another recognized stock exchange.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Limitation on Issuances of Guarantees of Indebtedness
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries that is not a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, directly or indirectly, to guarantee the payment of any Public Debt of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, unless such Restricted Subsidiary executes and delivers a supplemental indenture (reasonably promptly after the date on which such other guarantee is Incurred) providing for the guarantee of the payment of the Floating Rate SSNs by such Restricted Subsidiary, which guarantee will be senior to or pari passu with such Restricted Subsidiary’s guarantee of such other Indebtedness and on the same terms as the other Note Guarantees by Restricted Subsidiaries of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, except that: (1) if such Indebtedness is by its terms expressly subordinated to the Floating Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee, any such assumption, guarantee or other liability of such Restricted Subsidiary with respect to such Indebtedness shall be subordinated to such Restricted Subsidiary’s Note Guarantee at least to the same extent as such Indebtedness is subordinated to the Floating Rate SSNs or such Note Guarantee; and (2) no Note Guarantee shall be required if such Note Guarantee could reasonably be expected to give rise to or result in (A) personal liability for the Officers, directors, authorized signatories or shareholders of such Restricted Subsidiary, (B) any violation of applicable law that cannot be avoided or otherwise prevented through measures reasonably available to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Restricted Subsidiary, including, for the avoidance of doubt, “whitewash” or similar procedures, (C) any significant cost, expense, liability or obligation (including with respect of any Taxes) other than reasonable out-of-pocket expenses and other than reasonable expenses Incurred in connection with any governmental or regulatory filings required as a result of, or any measures pursuant to clause 293 ----- (B) undertaken in connection with, such Note Guarantee, which cannot be avoided through measures reasonably available to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the Restricted Subsidiary or (D) an inconsistency with the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or the Agreed Security Principles. The first paragraph of this covenant will not be applicable to any guarantees of any Restricted Subsidiary: (a) that existed at the time such Person became a Restricted Subsidiary if the guarantee was not Incurred in connection with, or in contemplation of, such Person becoming a Restricted Subsidiary; (b) arising solely due to the granting of a Permitted Lien that would not otherwise constitute a guarantee of Indebtedness of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor; (c) given to a bank or trust company incorporated in any member state of the European Union as of the date of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the United Kingdom or any commercial banking institution that is a member of the U.S. Federal Reserve System (or any branch, Subsidiary or Affiliate thereof), in each case having combined capital and surplus and undivided profits of not less than €500.0 million, whose debt has a rating, at the time such guarantee was given, of at least A or the equivalent thereof by S&P and at least A2 or the equivalent thereof by Moody’s, in connection with the operation of cash management programs established for the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s benefit or that of any Restricted Subsidiary; (d) that was a guarantor of the Revolving Credit Facility as of the Issue Date but was not a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor as of the Issue Date; (e) of Indebtedness that refinances Indebtedness which benefited from a guarantee by any such Restricted Subsidiary Incurred in compliance with this covenant immediately prior to such refinancing; or (f) any guarantees Incurred in connection with a Qualified Receivables Financing or Cash Management Services. Each such guarantee will be limited as necessary to recognize certain defenses generally available to guarantors (including those that relate to fraudulent conveyance or transfer, voidable preference, financial assistance, corporate purpose, capital maintenance or similar laws, regulations or defenses affecting the rights of creditors generally) or other considerations under applicable law. The form of such guarantee shall be the same as the form of a Note Guarantee, the form of which will be attached as an exhibit to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. Each guarantee of the Floating Rate SSNs shall be released in accordance with the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement described under “—The Note Guarantees” and “Description _of Other Indebtedness—Intercreditor Agreement”._

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Neither MidCo nor the Senior Notes Issuer shall carry on any material business or own any material assets or Incur any Indebtedness other than: (1) the ownership of shares or other debt or equity interests in MidCo, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, Lion Polaris II or the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer, as applicable; (2) (i) the provision of administrative services, legal, accounting and management services to its Subsidiaries of a type customarily provided by a holding company to its Subsidiaries and the ownership of assets necessary to provide such services and (ii) other transactions, activities and arrangements related to the establishment or maintenance of MidCo, the Senior Notes Issuer, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary’s corporate existence and otherwise consistent with the activities of a holding company and activities reasonably incidental thereto; (3) (a) the pledging of assets permitted to be or not prohibited from being the subject of Liens pursuant to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, (b) the Incurrence of Liens that are described in the definitions of “Permitted Liens” and “Permitted Collateral Liens” and (c) granting the relevant Liens under the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (4) (i) (A) entry into and incurrence of liabilities and performance of obligations and exercise of rights under the Floating Rate SSNs, its Note Guarantee, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Fixed Rate 294 ----- SSNs, the Fixed Rate SSN Indenture, its guarantee of the Fixed Rate SSNs, the Senior Notes, the Senior Notes Indenture, its guarantee of the Senior Notes, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, any security documents relating to the Fixed Rate SSNs, any security documents relating to the Senior Notes, the Revolving Credit Facility or Hedging Obligations and (B) entry into and incurrence of liabilities and performance of obligations and exercise of rights under guarantees of any Indebtedness of the Senior Notes Issuer, MidCo, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries permitted to be Incurred under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and (ii) (A) Incurring Parent Debt and any other Indebtedness permitted or not prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement and (B) entry into and incurrence of other liabilities (including guarantees of indebtedness or other obligations) and performance of obligations and exercise of rights under any Indebtedness permitted or not prohibited to be Incurred under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (5) (i) the ownership of cash, Cash Equivalents and Temporary Cash Investments and (ii) entry into, holding and utilization of Cash Management Services and participating in cash pooling and cash management arrangements, in each case to the extent not prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and reasonably relating to the other activities enumerated herein; (6) entry into and performance of obligations in respect of (i) contracts and agreements with its officers, directors and employees, (ii) subscription or purchase agreements for securities and/or preferred equity certificates, public offering rights agreements, voting and other stockholder agreements, engagement letters, underwriting agreements, agreements with rating agencies and other agreements in respect of its securities or any offering, issuance or sale thereof, (iii) engagement letters and reliance letters in respect of legal, accounting and other advice and/or reports received and/or commissioned by it, in each case, in relation to transactions which are authorized or not otherwise prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and (iv) Indebtedness owed by or to any Parent Entity, Subsidiary or Permitted Holder; (7) paying dividends, making distributions and other payments and making loans or advances to shareholders (and the receipt of repayments of any loans or advances) and pledging of assets to the extent not otherwise prohibited under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement and the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (8) (i) the issuance, offering, sale and listing of its Capital Stock or convertible bonds (including in an Equity Offering or Initial Public Offering), including compliance with applicable regulatory and other obligations in connection therewith and any activities related or reasonably incidental to any Equity Offering or Initial Public Offering, (ii) using the net cash proceeds of such issuance, or exchanging or converting such instruments, to fund the purchase, repurchase or redemption of, any Indebtedness or other equity or debt instrument of any Parent Entity or the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, or to contribute to the common equity of its direct Subsidiaries, to the extent permitted or not otherwise prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the relevant Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; and (iii) any purchase, repurchase, redemption, or the performance of the terms and conditions of, and exercise of rights in respect of, the foregoing, to the extent such activities are otherwise permitted or not otherwise prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the relevant Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, in each case, in relation to transactions authorized or not otherwise prohibited by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (9) the performance of obligations and exercise of rights under contracts or arrangements (including loans and bonds and other indebtedness) with any Permitted Holder, any Parent Entity or any Subsidiary entered into in compliance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (10) the undertaking of a Permitted Reorganization or Post-Closing Merger; (11) other activities (i) not specifically enumerated above that are incidental to the foregoing or are de minimis in nature, (ii) consistent with activities undertaken on the Issue Date or (iii) in connection with the Transactions; (12) from time to time, receipt in a transaction not otherwise prohibited under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents of properties and assets (including cash, Cash Equivalents, Temporary Cash Investments, shares of Capital Stock of another Person and/or Indebtedness and other obligations) for the purpose of transferring such properties and assets to any Parent Entity, any Subsidiary or any other Person, so long as in any case such further transfer is made promptly by MidCo or the Senior Notes Issuer, as applicable; or 295 ----- (13) the entry into and performance of any tax sharing agreement, the making and receipt of Permitted Parent Payments and any other transaction, activities and arrangements contemplated by the covenant described under “—Limitation on Affiliate Transactions”.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Notes Issuer will not, and will not cause or permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries to, take or knowingly or negligently omit to take any action which action or omission would or could reasonably be expected to have the result of materially impairing the security interest with respect to the Collateral owned by such entity (it being understood that the Incurrence of Liens on the Collateral permitted by the definition of Permitted Collateral Liens shall under no circumstances be deemed to materially impair the security interest with respect to the Collateral) for the benefit of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs, and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will not, and will not cause or permit any of its Restricted Subsidiaries to, grant to any Person other than the Security Agent, for the benefit of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs and the other beneficiaries described in the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement, any Lien over any of the Collateral that is prohibited by the covenant described above under the caption “—Liens”; provided that (a) nothing in this provision shall restrict the discharge or release of the Collateral in accordance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement, (b) the Senior Notes Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries may Incur Permitted Collateral Liens and (c) the Senior Notes Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries may discharge and release Collateral in connection with the implementation of a Permitted Reorganization or Post-Closing Merger (subject to compliance with the conditions set forth in the definition of “Permitted Reorganization” or “Post-Closing Merger”, as applicable); and provided further, however, that in the case of clauses (a), (b) and (c), except as provided in the next paragraph, no Floating Rate SSN Security Document may be amended, extended, renewed, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified, replaced, or released (followed by an immediate retaking of a Lien of at least equivalent ranking over the same assets) (provided that a confirmation agreement in respect of any Floating Rate SSN Security Document shall not be deemed to be an amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, replacement, release or other modification of that Floating Rate SSN Security Document for purposes of this covenant) unless contemporaneously with such amendment, extension, replacement, restatement, supplement, modification, renewal or release (followed by an immediate retaking of a Lien of at least equivalent ranking over the assets), the Floating Rate SSN Issuer delivers to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent either (1) a solvency opinion from an internationally recognized investment bank or accounting firm, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee confirming the solvency of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, supplement, modification or replacement or release, (2) a certificate from the board of directors or the chief financial officer of the relevant Person or the Floating Rate SSN Issuer amending, extending, renewing, restating, supplementing, modifying, replacing or releasing and retaking such Floating Rate SSN Security Document which confirms the solvency of such Person after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification or release and retaking and replacement, or (3) an opinion of counsel, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (subject to customary exceptions and qualifications), confirming that, after giving effect to any transactions related to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release and retaking, the Lien or Liens securing the Floating Rate SSNs created under the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents so amended, extended, renewed, restated, supplemented, modified or replaced are valid and perfected Liens not otherwise subject to any limitation imperfection or new hardening period, in equity or at law, and that such Lien or Liens were not otherwise subject to immediately prior to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release and retaking. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent will be entitled to conclusively rely upon such certificate or opinion (as the case may be), without independent verification. At the direction of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and without the consent of the holders of Floating Rate SSNs, the Security Agent may from time to time enter into one or more amendments to the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents to: (i) cure any ambiguity, omission, defect, manifest error or inconsistency therein, (ii) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) provide for Permitted Collateral Liens, (iii) add to the Collateral, (iv) comply with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, (v) evidence the succession of another Person to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor and the assumption by such successor of the obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, the applicable Note Guarantee and the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, in each case, in accordance with “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets” or in connection with 296 ----- a Permitted Reorganization or IPO Pushdown, (vi) provide for the release of property and assets constituting Collateral from the Lien of the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents or the release of the Note Guarantee of a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, in each case, in accordance with (and if permitted by) the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, (vii) conform the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents to this “Description of the _Floating Rate Senior Secured Notes”, (viii) evidence and provide for the acceptance of the appointment of a_ successor Floating Rate SSN Trustee or Security Agent, (ix) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) to provide for Additional Floating Rate SSNs to also benefit from the Collateral or (x) (but subject to compliance with the immediately preceding paragraph) make any other change thereto that does not adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs in any material respect. In the event that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer complies with this covenant, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent shall (subject to customary protections and indemnifications) consent to such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement, modification, replacement or release with no need for instructions from holders of the Floating Rate SSNs.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: At the request of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and without the consent of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs, at the time of, or prior to, the Incurrence by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor of Indebtedness permitted to share in the Collateral, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent shall enter into with the holders of such Indebtedness (or their duly authorized representatives) an additional intercreditor agreement (an “Additional Intercreditor Agreement”) on substantially the same (or not materially less favorable to the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs) terms as the Intercreditor Agreement or an amendment to the Intercreditor Agreement (which amendment does not adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs in any material respect, as determined in good faith by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer), it being understood that, for the avoidance of doubt, an increase in the amount of Indebtedness being subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement will be deemed to be on substantially similar terms to the Intercreditor Agreement and will be deemed not to adversely affect the rights of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs and will be permitted by this covenant if, in each case, the Incurrence of such Indebtedness (and any Lien in its favor) is permitted by the covenants described under the captions “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of _Preferred Stock” and “—Liens”._ At the request of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, without the consent of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, the Security Agent and the Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall enter into one or more amendments to any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement to: (1) cure defects, resolve ambiguities or reflect changes, in each case, of a minor, technical or administrative nature, (2) increase the amount or types of Indebtedness covered by any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement that may be Incurred by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor that is subject to any Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement (provided that such amendment is consistent with the preceding paragraph), (3) add new Restricted Subsidiaries, Floating Rate SSN Guarantors or other parties (such as representatives of new issuances of Indebtedness) to the Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement, (4) further secure the Floating Rate SSNs, (5) make provision for the security securing Additional Floating Rate SSNs to rank pari _passu with the Collateral, (6) implement any Permitted Collateral Liens, (7) amend the Intercreditor Agreement_ or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement in accordance with the terms thereof, (8) to facilitate a Permitted Reorganization or Post-Closing Merger or (9) make any other change to any such Intercreditor Agreement or an Additional Intercreditor Agreement that does not adversely affect the rights of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs in any material respect. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer may only direct the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to enter into any amendment to the extent such amendment does not impose any personal obligations on the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent or adversely affect the rights, duties, liabilities or immunities of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement. In relation to the Intercreditor Agreement or, to the extent applicable, an Additional Intercreditor Agreement, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall be deemed to have consented on behalf of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs to any payment, repayment, purchase, repurchase, defeasance, acquisition, retirement or redemption of any obligations subordinated to the Floating Rate SSNs thereby; provided that such transaction would comply with the covenant described under “—Restricted Payments”. 297 ----- Each holder of the Floating Rate SSNs shall be deemed to have agreed to and accepted the terms and conditions of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement (whether then entered into or entered into in the future pursuant to the provisions described herein) and to have consented to and directed the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent to enter into any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any amendment of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement which complies with the foregoing provision and the conditions contained therein.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Suspension of Covenants When Floating Rate SSNs Rated Investment Grade
Subsubsection Text: If on any date following the Issue Date: (1) the Floating Rate SSNs have achieved Investment Grade Status; and (2) no Default or Event of Default shall have occurred and be continuing on such date, then, beginning on that day and continuing until such time, if any, at which the Floating Rate SSNs cease to have Investment Grade Status (such period, the “Suspension Period”), the covenants specifically listed under the following captions in this “Description of the Floating Rate Senior Secured Notes” will no longer be applicable to the Floating Rate SSNs and any related default provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture will cease to be effective and will not be applicable to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries: (1) “—Repurchase at the Option of Holders—Asset Sales”; (2) “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Preferred Stock”; (3) “—Restricted Payments”; (4) “—Dividend and Other Payment Restrictions Affecting Restricted Subsidiaries”; (5) clause (4) of the first paragraph of the covenant described under “—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of _Assets”;_ (6) “—Transactions with Affiliates”; (7) “—Designation of Restricted and Unrestricted Subsidiaries”; (8) “—Limitation on Issuances of Guarantees of Indebtedness”; and (9) “—Impairment of Security Interests”. Such covenants will not, however, be of any effect with regard to the actions of Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Restricted Subsidiaries properly taken during the continuance of the Suspension Period; provided that (1) the covenant described under the caption “—Restricted Payments” will be interpreted as if it has been in effect since the date of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture other than during the Suspension Period, (2) all Indebtedness Incurred, or Disqualified Stock or Preferred Stock issued, during the Suspension Period will be classified to have been Incurred or issued pursuant to clause (2) of the second paragraph of the caption “—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Preferred Stock”, (3) any transactions prohibited by the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Transactions with Affiliates” entered into after such reinstatement pursuant to an agreement entered into during any Suspension Period shall be deemed to be permitted pursuant to clause (10) of the second paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Transactions with _Affiliates”, and (4) any encumbrance or restriction on the ability of any Restricted Subsidiary to take any action_ described in clauses (1) through (3) of the first paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain _Covenants—Dividend and Other Payment Restrictions Affecting Restricted Subsidiaries” that becomes effective_ during any Suspension Period shall be deemed to be permitted pursuant to clause (3) of the second paragraph of the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Dividend and Other Payment Restrictions Affecting _Restricted Subsidiaries”. Upon the occurrence of a Suspension Period, the amount of Excess Proceeds shall be_ reset at zero. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall notify the Floating Rate SSN Trustee upon the occurrence of a Suspension Period; provided that such notice shall not be a condition of the suspension of covenants described under this heading having effect and the failure to deliver such notice shall not be a Default or Event of Default under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. There can be no assurance that the Floating Rate SSNs will ever achieve or maintain an Investment Grade Status. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall have no duty to monitor the ratings of the Floating Rate SSNs, shall not be deemed to have any knowledge of the ratings of the Floating Rate SSNs and shall have no duty to notify Holders if the Floating Rate SSNs achieve Investment Grade Status or upon the occurrence or cessation of any Suspension Period. 298 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: When determining whether any transaction is permitted under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture (including, without limitation, determining compliance with any basket, ratio or threshold, or whether a Change of Control, Default or Event of Default has or would occur as a result of such transaction, in each case, in connection with the Incurrence of any Indebtedness (and use of proceeds thereof), the creation of any Lien, the making of any Restricted Payment or Investment, the issuance or sale of Capital Stock, the sale or other disposition of any assets, any merger, consolidation or other business combination or Affiliate Transaction), the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall be permitted to test it, at its option, (i) on the date binding documentation for such transaction is entered into, (ii) on the date that any notice of any repayment, redemption, repurchase or refinancing of any Indebtedness is given to the holders thereof (if applicable), or (iii) on the date such transaction is consummated. If the Floating Rate SSN Issuer elects to test the transaction as described in clauses (i) or (ii) above, the determination as to whether the transaction is permitted under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture shall be made assuming that the transaction and other transactions to be entered into in connection therewith were consummated on the date binding documentation was entered into or such notice was given (each, an “Alternative Testing Date”), as applicable. If the transaction was permitted on the Alternative Testing Date chosen by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, it shall continue to be deemed so permitted under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture even if it would have otherwise resulted in a Default or an Event of Default on the date it is consummated. When determining whether any transaction is permitted under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture as of the Alternative Testing Date, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will make all necessary calculations as set forth under the definitions of “Consolidated Net Leverage Ratio”, “Consolidated Net Senior Secured Leverage Ratio” and “Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio”. If the Floating Rate SSN Issuer has elected to test a transaction on an Alternative Testing Date (an “Alternative Testing Date Election”), the transaction shall be deemed to have occurred on such date for the purposes of making any other determination under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; provided that an Alternative Testing Date Election shall cease to apply if (a) the transaction is definitively terminated, cancelled or abandoned or (b) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer has revoked its Alternative Testing Date Election and has instead opted to test the transaction on the date it is consummated, which the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will be entitled to do at any time until the transaction is consummated (such time, the “Election Termination Time”). From the time the Floating Rate SSN Issuer makes an Alternative Testing Date Election to the related Election Termination Time, the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture will apply assuming that the relevant transaction was consummated on the Alternative Testing Date. No action properly taken by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries between an Alternative Testing Date Election and the related Election Termination Time will constitute a Default or an Event of Default under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. In addition, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture will permit, without causing a Default or Event of Default, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of the Restricted Subsidiaries to honor any contractual commitments undertaken during such period of time, so long as they were not undertaken in anticipation of the Election Termination Time. When calculating a percentage of Consolidated EBITDA to determine compliance with any covenant herein, such percentage shall be measured based on the Consolidated EBITDA of the Senior Notes Issuer for the most recently ended four full fiscal quarters for which internal financial statements are available immediately preceding the date of determination, calculated on a pro forma basis giving effect to the relevant transaction.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: So long as any Floating Rate SSNs are outstanding, the Senior Notes Issuer will furnish to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee: (1) within 120 days after the end of the Senior Notes Issuer’s fiscal year beginning with the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022, annual reports containing the following information: (a) audited consolidated balance sheet of the Senior Notes Issuer as of the end of the most recent fiscal year (and comparative information for the end of the prior fiscal year) and audited consolidated income statement and statement of cash flow of the Senior Notes Issuer for the most recent fiscal year (and comparative information for the prior fiscal year), including footnotes to such financial statements and the report of the independent auditors on the financial statements; (b) to the extent applicable, pro forma income statement and balance sheet information of the Senior Notes Issuer, which, for the avoidance of doubt, shall not include the provision of a full income statement or balance sheet to the extent not reasonably available, together with explanatory footnotes, for any material acquisitions or dispositions (including, without limitation, any acquisitions or disposition that, individually or in the aggregate when considered with all other acquisition or dispositions that have occurred since the beginning of the most 299 ----- recently completed fiscal year as to which such annual report relates, represent greater than 20% of the consolidated revenues, EBITDA, or assets of the Senior Notes Issuer on a pro forma basis) or recapitalizations that have occurred since the beginning of the most recently completed fiscal year as to which such annual report relates, in each case unless pro forma information has been provided in a previous report pursuant to clause (2) or (3) below; provided that such pro forma financial information will be provided only to the extent available without unreasonable expense, in which case the Senior Notes Issuer will provide, in the case of a material acquisition, acquired company financial statements; (c) an operating and financial review of the audited financial statements, including a discussion of the results of operations (including a discussion by business segment, if any), financial condition and liquidity and capital resources, and a discussion of material commitments and contingencies and critical accounting policies; (d) a description of the business, management and shareholders of the Senior Notes Issuer, all material affiliate transactions, Indebtedness and material financing arrangements and a description of all material contractual arrangements, including material debt instruments; (e) material business risk factors and material recent developments; and (f) to the extent applicable, any changes to the description of the material differences in the financial condition and results of operations between the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Senior Notes Issuer other than with respect to ownership (including any employee incentive plan or arrangement) or management (it being understood that any payment of interest on existing Indebtedness (including cash interest and pay in kind or capitalized interest) shall not constitute a material change); (2) within 60 days following the end of each of the first three fiscal quarters in each fiscal year of the Senior Notes Issuer beginning with the fiscal quarter ending June 30, 2021, quarterly reports containing the following information: (a) an unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet as of the end of such quarter and unaudited condensed statements of income and cash flow for the year to date periods ending on the unaudited condensed balance sheet date, and the comparable prior year periods for the Senior Notes Issuer, together with condensed footnote disclosure; (b) to the extent applicable, pro _forma income statement and balance sheet information, which, for the avoidance of doubt, shall not_ include the provision of a full income statement or balance sheet to the extent not reasonably available, together with explanatory footnotes, for any material acquisitions or dispositions (including, without limitation, any acquisition or disposition that, individually or in the aggregate when considered with all other acquisitions or dispositions that have occurred since the beginning of the most recent completed fiscal quarter as to which such quarterly report relates, represents greater than 20% of the consolidated revenues, EBITDA or assets of the Senior Notes Issuer on a pro forma basis) or recapitalizations that have occurred since the beginning of the most recently completed fiscal quarter as to which such quarterly report relates, in each case unless pro forma information has been provided in a previous report pursuant to clause (1), (2) or (3) of this covenant; provided that such pro forma financial information will be provided only to the extent available without unreasonable expense, in which case the Senior Notes Issuer will provide, in the case of a material acquisition, acquired company financial statements; (c) an operating and financial review of the unaudited financial statements (including a discussion by business segment, if any), including a discussion of the consolidated financial condition and results of operations of the Senior Notes Issuer and any material change between the current quarterly period and the corresponding period of the prior year; (d) material recent developments in the business of the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries; (e) any material changes to the business risk factors disclosed in the most recent annual report with respect to the Senior Notes Issuer; and (f) to the extent applicable, any changes to the description of the material differences in the financial condition and results of operations between the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Senior Notes Issuer other than with respect to ownership (including any employee incentive plan or arrangement) or management (it being understood that any payment of interest on existing Indebtedness (including cash interest and pay in kind or capitalized interest) shall not constitute a material change); and (3) promptly after the occurrence of (a) a material acquisition, disposition or restructuring (including any acquisition or disposition that would require the delivery of pro forma financial information pursuant to clause (1) or (2) above); (b) any senior management change at the Senior Notes Issuer; (c) any change in the auditors of the Senior Notes Issuer; (d) any resignation of a member of the Board of Directors of the Senior Notes Issuer as a result of a disagreement with the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the Senior Notes Issuer, as applicable; (e) the entering into an agreement that will result in a Change of Control; or (f) any material events that the Senior Notes Issuer announces publicly, in each case, a report containing a description of such events; _provided, however, that the reports set forth in clauses (1), (2) and (3) above will not be required to_ (i) contain any reconciliation to U.S. generally accepted accounting principles or (ii) include separate 300 ----- financial statements for any Floating Rate SSN Guarantors or non-guarantor Subsidiaries of the Senior Notes Issuer. Delivery of such reports, information and documents to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall be for informational purposes only and the Floating Rate SSN Trustee’s receipt of such shall not constitute actual or constructive notice of any information contained therein or determinable from information contained therein, including the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s compliance with any of its covenants under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSNs (as to which the Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall be entitled to rely exclusively on Officer’s Certificates). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in respect of the reports set forth in clauses (1) and (2) above, if the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries have material operational activities other than the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Subsidiaries for the periods that are the subject of such reports, as disclosed on such report, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall provide each report required by clauses (1) and (2) above for such period as if each reference to “the Senior Notes Issuer” had been to “the Floating Rate SSN Issuer”. At any time that any of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s Subsidiaries are Unrestricted Subsidiaries and any such Unrestricted Subsidiary or group of Unrestricted Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, constitutes a Significant Subsidiary of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, then the quarterly and annual financial information required by the preceding paragraph will include a reasonably detailed presentation, either on the face of the financial statements or in the footnotes thereto, of the financial condition and results of operations of the Senior Notes Issuer and its Subsidiaries (other than any Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer) separate from the financial condition and results of operations of the Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer. All financial statements shall be prepared in accordance with IFRS (without giving effect to the proviso in the definition thereof); provided, however, that the reports set forth in clauses (1), (2) and (3) above may, in the event of a change in applicable IFRS, present earlier periods on a basis that applied to such periods, subject to the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. Except as provided for above, no report need include separate financial statements for the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or Subsidiaries of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any disclosure with respect to the results of operations or any other financial or statistical disclosure not of a type included in this offering memorandum. At its election, the Senior Notes Issuer may provide consolidated financial statements of a Parent Entity (or any new holding company created following a Permitted Reorganization) in lieu of those for the Senior Notes Issuer, in which case references to the Senior Notes Issuer in clauses (1) and (2) of the preceding paragraph will be deemed to be references to the Parent Entity or new holding company, as applicable. In addition, for so long as any Floating Rate SSNs remain outstanding and during any period during which the Floating Rate SSN Issuer is not subject to Section 13 or 15(d) of the U.S. Exchange Act nor exempt therefrom pursuant to Rule 12g3-2(b), the Floating Rate SSN Issuer has agreed that it will furnish to the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs and to securities analysts and prospective investors, upon their request, the information required to be delivered pursuant to Rule 144A(d)(4) under the U.S. Securities Act. The Senior Notes Issuer will also make available copies of all reports required by clauses (1) through (3) of the first paragraph of the covenant (i) on the Senior Notes Issuer’s website and (ii) if and so long as the Floating Rate SSNs are listed on the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange so require, at the specified office of the Floating Rate SSN Paying Agent. In the event that, and for so long as, the equity securities of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Parent Entity or any IPO Entity are listed on the regulated market of Euronext Paris (or one of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom) and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Parent Entity or IPO Entity is subject to the Admission and Disclosure Standards applicable to issuers of equity securities admitted to trading on the regulated market of Euronext Paris (or the equivalent standards applicable to issuers of equity securities admitted to trading on one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom), for so long as it elects, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will make available to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee such annual and semiannual reports, information, documents and other reports that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or such Parent Entity or IPO Entity is, or would be, required to file with Euronext Paris pursuant to such Admission and Disclosure Standards (or the applicable standards of one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom, as applicable). Upon complying with the foregoing requirements, and provided that such requirements require the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Parent Entity or IPO Entity to prepare and file annual and semiannual reports, information, documents and other reports with the regulated market of Euronext Paris, or one or more of the equivalent regulated markets in the European Union or the United Kingdom, as applicable, the Senior Notes Issuer and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer will be deemed to have complied with the provisions contained in the preceding paragraphs. 301 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Title: Limitation on actions with respect to the PG Intra-Group Loan
Subsubsection Text: (1) The Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall not sell, assign or otherwise transfer or forgive or waive any principal amount of the PG Intra-Group Loan (other than to secure the Floating Rate SSNs, any Note Guarantee or the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or to grant Permitted Collateral Liens); (2) neither the Floating Rate SSN Issuer nor the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer shall (i) amend the PG Intra-Group Loan in a manner adverse in any material respect to the Holders (as determined in good faith by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer), other than any amendment to the interest terms including the interest rates payable thereunder or (ii) shorten the maturity the PG Intra-Group Loan to a date prior to the Stated Maturity of the Floating Rate SSNs unless the maturity of the corresponding Floating Rate SSNs is also similarly shortened; provided that any amendment to the PG Intra-Group Loan shall be permitted from time to time to align the redemption provisions, maturity, covenants or any other terms thereof to the corresponding terms of the Floating Rate SSNs initially issued on the Issue Date (as may be amended, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time); and (3) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer shall not receive or accept any repayment or prepayment of principal in respect of the PG Intra-Group Loan prior to its maturity or convert the PG Intra-Group Loan into equity of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer or otherwise reduce the outstanding principal amount thereof except to pay interest, premium or Additional Amounts with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs or to facilitate or accommodate or reflect a repayment, redemption or repurchase of outstanding Floating Rate SSNs; _provided that the amount of any such repayment, prepayment, conversion or reduction of principal_ amount of the PG Intra-Group Loan shall be no greater than the interest, premium, Additional Amounts or principal amount of any corresponding Floating Rate SSNs being paid. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the PG Intra-Group Loan may be canceled, forgiven or otherwise repaid, released or discharged upon: (a) a sale or other disposition (including by way of consolidation or merger) of the Capital Stock of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer (whether by direct sale or sale of a holding company), if the sale or other disposition does not violate the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer ceases to be a Restricted Subsidiary as a result of the sale or other disposition; (b) the sale or disposition of all or substantially all the assets of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer (other than to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries), if the sale or other disposition does not violate the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (c) defeasance or discharge of the Floating Rate SSNs, as provided in “—Defeasance” and “— _Satisfaction and discharge”;_ (d) in accordance with the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement; (e) as described under “—Amendments and waivers”; (f) as a result of a transaction permitted by “—Merger and consolidation”; (g) to the extent such cancellation, forgiveness, repayment, release or discharge, whether by capitalization or otherwise, is necessary to pay any applicable Taxes or to comply with applicable tax regulations regarding the deductibility of interest expense (as determined in good faith by the Board of Directors or a member of senior management of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer); and (h) the designation of the Fixed Rate SSN Issuer as an Unrestricted Subsidiary in accordance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent shall take all necessary actions reasonably requested by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, including the granting of releases or waivers under the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, to effectuate any repayment or release of the PG Intra-Group Loan in accordance with these provisions, subject to customary protections and indemnifications. Each of the releases set forth above shall be effected by the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent without the consent (except to the extent required under clause (e) above) of or liability to the Holders or any other action or consent on the part of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent. 302 -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Each of the following is an “Event of Default”: (1) default for 30 days in the payment when due of interest or Additional Amounts, if any, with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs; (2) default in the payment when due (at maturity, upon redemption or otherwise) of the principal of, or premium, if any, on, the Floating Rate SSNs; (3) failure by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the relevant Floating Rate SSN Guarantor for 60 days after written notice to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer by the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs then outstanding voting as a single class to comply with any of the agreements in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture (other than a default in performance, or breach, or a covenant or agreement which is specifically dealt with in clauses (1) or (2), or the Floating Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents); (4) default under any mortgage, indenture or instrument under which there may be issued or by which there may be secured or evidenced any Indebtedness for money borrowed by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries (or the payment of which is guaranteed by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries), whether such Indebtedness or guarantee now exists, or is created after the Issue Date, if that default: (a) is caused by a failure to pay principal of such Indebtedness at the Stated Maturity thereof prior to the expiration of the grace period provided in such Indebtedness on the date of such default (a “Payment Default”); or (b) results in the acceleration of such Indebtedness prior to its express maturity, and, in each case, the principal amount of any such Indebtedness, together with the principal amount of any other such Indebtedness under which there has been a Payment Default or the maturity of which has been so accelerated, aggregates €50 million or more; (5) failure by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary to pay final judgments entered by a court or courts of competent jurisdiction aggregating in excess of €50 million (exclusive of any amounts that a solvent insurance company has acknowledged liability for), which judgments shall not have been discharged or waived and there shall have been a period of 60 consecutive days during which a stay of enforcement of such judgment or order, by reason of an appeal, waiver or otherwise, shall not have been in effect; (6) (i) any security interest created by the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents ceases to be in full force and effect (except as permitted by the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents) with respect to Collateral having a Fair Market Value in excess of €50.0 million and such failure to be in full force and effect has continued uncured for a period of 20 days or an assertion by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, any of its Restricted Subsidiaries or any grantor of any security interest over the Collateral that any Collateral is not subject to a valid, perfected security interest (except as permitted by the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents); or (ii) the repudiation by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the grantor of any security interest over the Collateral of any of its material obligations under the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (7) except as permitted by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, if any Note Guarantee is held in any judicial proceeding to be unenforceable or invalid or ceases for any reason to be in full force and effect and such Default continues for 20 days, or any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor or any Person acting on behalf of any such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, denies or disaffirms its obligations under its Note Guarantee; and (8) certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency described in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture with respect to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries that is a Significant Subsidiary or any group of its Restricted Subsidiaries that, taken together (as of the latest audited consolidated financial statements for the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries), would constitute a Significant Subsidiary. In the case of an Event of Default specified in clause (8), all outstanding Floating Rate SSNs will become due and payable immediately without further action or notice. If any other Event of Default occurs and is continuing, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the 303 ----- then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs may and, if directed by holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee shall, declare all the Floating Rate SSNs to be due and payable immediately. For the avoidance of doubt, it will not constitute an Event of Default if the Floating Rate SSN Issuer fails to satisfy the Sustainability Performance Targets by December 31, 2023, or fails to provide reports with respect to its performance against the Sustainability Performance Targets, and the sole recourse of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs in such instance shall be the right to receive the applicable increase in interest rate margin, in the manner described under the heading “—Principal, Maturity and Interest”. Subject to certain limitations, holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs may direct the Floating Rate SSN Trustee in its exercise of any trust or power. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee may withhold from holders of the Floating Rate SSNs notice of any continuing Default or Event of Default if it determines that withholding notice is in their interest, except a Default or Event of Default relating to the payment of principal, interest or Additional Amounts or premium, if any. Subject to the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture relating to the duties of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, in case an Event of Default occurs and is continuing, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee will be under no obligation to exercise any of the rights or powers under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture at the request or direction of any holders of Floating Rate SSNs unless such holders have offered to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee indemnity and/or security (including by way of prefunding) satisfactory to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee in its sole discretion against any loss, liability or expense. Except (subject to the provisions described under _“—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver”) to enforce the right to receive payment of principal, premium, if any,_ or interest or Additional Amounts when due, no holder of a Floating Rate SSN may pursue any remedy with respect to the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or the Floating Rate SSNs unless: (1) such holder has previously given the Floating Rate SSN Trustee notice that an Event of Default is continuing; (2) holders of at least 30% in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs have requested the Floating Rate SSN Trustee to pursue the remedy; (3) such holders have offered the Floating Rate SSN Trustee security and/or indemnity (including by way of prefunding) satisfactory to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee in its sole discretion against any loss, liability or expense; (4) the Floating Rate SSN Trustee has not complied with such request within 60 days after the receipt of the request and the offer of security and/or indemnity (including by way of prefunding); and (5) holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs have not given the Floating Rate SSN Trustee a direction inconsistent with such request within such 60-day period. The holders of not less than a majority in aggregate principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs outstanding may, on behalf of the holders of all outstanding Floating Rate SSNs, waive any past Default under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and its consequences, except a continuing Default in the payment of the principal or premium, if any, any Additional Amounts or interest on any Floating Rate SSN held by a non-consenting holder (which may only be waived with the consent of holders of the Floating Rate SSNs holding 90% of the aggregate principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs outstanding under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture). Holders of Floating Rate SSNs may not enforce the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, except as provided in the Intercreditor Agreement. The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that in the event an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing of which the Floating Rate SSN Trustee has written notice, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee will be required in the exercise of its powers to use the degree of care that a prudent person would use in the conduct of its own affairs. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee, however, may refuse to follow any direction that conflicts with law or the Floating Rate SSN Indenture or that the Floating Rate SSN Trustee determines is materially prejudicial to the rights of any other Holder or that would involve the Floating Rate SSN Trustee in personal liability. The Floating Rate SSN Issuer is required to deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee annually a statement regarding compliance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture within 120 days after the end of each financial year. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent may assume without inquiry, in the absence of actual 304 ----- knowledge, that the Floating Rate SSN Issuer is duly complying with its obligations contained in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture required to be observed and performed by it, and that no Default or Event of Default or other event that would require repayment of the Floating Rate SSNs has occurred. The Floating Rate SSN Indenture will provide that (i) if a Default (a “Subsequent Default”) occurs solely as a result of an action taken while a Default (an “Initial Default”) for a failure to deliver a required certificate (unrelated to the action in respect of the Subsequent Default) is pending and the Initial Default is cured, such Subsequent Default will also be cured without any further action and (ii) any Default or Event of Default for the failure to comply with the time periods prescribed in the covenant entitled “—Reports” or otherwise to deliver any notice or certificate pursuant to any other provision of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture shall be deemed to be cured upon the delivery of any such report required by such covenant or notice or certificate, as applicable, even though such delivery is not within the prescribed period specified in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsection Title: No Personal Liability of Directors, Officers, Employees and Stockholders
Subsubsection Text: No director, officer, employee, authorized signatory, incorporator or stockholder of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor, as such, will have any liability for any obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors under the Floating Rate SSNs, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Note Guarantees, the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or for any claim based on, in respect of, or by reason of, such obligations or their creation. Each holder of Floating Rate SSNs by accepting a Floating Rate SSN waives and releases all such liability. The waiver and release are part of the consideration for issuance of the Floating Rate SSNs. The waiver may not be effective to waive liabilities under applicable securities laws.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: The Floating Rate SSN Issuer may at any time, at the option of its Board of Directors evidenced by a resolution set forth in an Officer’s Certificate, elect to have all of its obligations discharged with respect to the outstanding Floating Rate SSNs and all obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors discharged with respect to their Note Guarantees (“Legal Defeasance”) except for: (1) the rights of holders of outstanding Floating Rate SSNs to receive payments in respect of the principal of, or interest (including Additional Amounts) or premium, if any, on, such Floating Rate SSNs when such payments are due from the trust referred to below; (2) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s obligations with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs concerning issuing temporary Floating Rate SSNs, registration of Floating Rate SSNs, mutilated, destroyed, lost or stolen Floating Rate SSNs and the maintenance of an office or agency for payment and money for security payments held in trust; (3) the rights, powers, trusts, duties and immunities of the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors’ obligations in connection therewith; and (4) the Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture. In addition, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer may, at its option and at any time, elect to have the obligations of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer and the Floating Rate SSN Guarantors released with respect to certain covenants (including its obligation to make Change of Control Offers and Asset Sale Offers) that are described in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture (“Covenant Defeasance”) and thereafter any omission to comply with those covenants will not constitute a Default or Event of Default with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs. In the event Covenant Defeasance occurs, all Events of Default described under “—Events of Default and Remedies” (except those relating to payments on the Floating Rate SSNs or, solely with respect to the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, bankruptcy or insolvency events) will no longer constitute an Event of Default with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs. In order to exercise either Legal Defeasance or Covenant Defeasance: (1) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must irrevocably deposit with the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, in trust, for the benefit of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs, cash in euro, non-callable European Government Obligations or a combination of cash in euro and non-callable European Government Obligations, in amounts as will be sufficient, in the opinion of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, acting in good faith, to pay the principal of, or interest (including Additional Amounts and premium, if any) on the outstanding 305 ----- Floating Rate SSNs on the stated date for payment thereof or on the applicable redemption date, as the case may be, and the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must specify whether the Floating Rate SSNs are being defeased to such stated date for payment or to a particular redemption date; (2) in the case of Legal Defeasance, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee an opinion reasonably acceptable to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee of United States counsel confirming that (i) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer has received from, or there has been published by, the U.S. Internal Revenue Service a ruling or (ii) since the Issue Date, there has been a change in the applicable U.S. Federal income tax law, in either case to the effect that, and based thereon such opinion of counsel will confirm that, the holders of the outstanding Floating Rate SSNs will not recognize income, gain or loss for U.S. Federal income tax purposes as a result of such Legal Defeasance and will be subject to tax on the same amounts, in the same manner and at the same times as would have been the case if such Legal Defeasance had not occurred; (3) in the case of Covenant Defeasance, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, an opinion reasonably acceptable to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee of United States counsel confirming that the holders of the outstanding Floating Rate SSNs will not recognize income, gain or loss for U.S. Federal income tax purposes as a result of such Covenant Defeasance and will be subject to U.S. Federal income tax on the same amounts, in the same manner and at the same times as would have been the case if such Covenant Defeasance had not occurred; (4) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee an Officer’s Certificate stating that the deposit was not made by the Floating Rate SSN Issuer with the intent of preferring the holders of Floating Rate SSNs over the other creditors of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer with the intent of defeating, hindering, delaying or defrauding any creditors of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer or others; and (5) the Floating Rate SSN Issuer must deliver to the Floating Rate SSN Trustee an Officer’s Certificate and an opinion of counsel, subject to customary assumptions and qualifications, each stating that all conditions precedent relating to the Legal Defeasance or the Covenant Defeasance have been complied with. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee will be entitled to conclusively rely upon such Officer’s Certificates and opinions without independent verification.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF THE FLOATING RATE SENIOR SECURED NOTES
Subsubsection Text: Except as provided otherwise in the succeeding paragraphs, the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees, the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement may be amended or supplemented with the consent of the holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the Floating Rate SSNs then outstanding (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Floating Rate SSNs), and any existing Default or Event of Default or compliance with any provision of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees, the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement may be waived with the consent of the holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Floating Rate SSNs). Unless consented to by the holders of at least 90% (or in the case of clause (10) below, 80%) of the aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs (including, without limitation, consents obtained in connection with a purchase of, or tender offer or exchange offer for, Floating Rate SSNs), an amendment, supplement or waiver may not (with respect to any Floating Rate SSNs held by a non-consenting holder): (1) reduce the principal amount of Floating Rate SSNs whose holders must consent to an amendment, supplement or waiver; (2) reduce the principal of or change the fixed maturity of any Floating Rate SSN or alter the provisions with respect to the redemption of the Floating Rate SSNs (other than provisions relating to the covenants described above under the caption “—Repurchase at the Option of Holders”); (3) reduce the rate of or change the time for payment of interest, including default interest, on any Floating Rate SSN; 306 ----- (4) impair the contractual right of any holder of Floating Rate SSNs to receive payment of principal of and interest on such holder’s Floating Rate SSNs on or after the due dates therefor or to institute suit for the enforcement of any payment on or with respect to such holder’s Floating Rate SSNs or any Note Guarantee in respect thereof; (5) waive a Default or Event of Default in the payment of principal of, or interest, Additional Amounts or premium, if any, on, the Floating Rate SSNs (except a rescission of acceleration of the Floating Rate SSNs by the holders of at least a majority in aggregate principal amount of the then outstanding Floating Rate SSNs and a waiver of the Payment Default that resulted from such acceleration); (6) make any Floating Rate SSN payable in money other than that stated in the Floating Rate SSNs; (7) make any change in the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture relating to waivers of past Defaults or the rights of holders of Floating Rate SSNs to receive payments of principal of, or interest, Additional Amounts or premium, if any, on, the Floating Rate SSNs; (8) make any change in the preceding amendment and waiver provisions; (9) release all or substantially all the Note Guarantees, except in accordance with the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement; or (10) release all or substantially all the security interests granted for the benefit of the holders of the Floating Rate SSNs in the Collateral, except in accordance with the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents. Notwithstanding the preceding paragraphs, without the consent of any holder of Floating Rate SSNs, the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and, with respect to the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents and the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Agent may amend or supplement the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, any Note Guarantee, any of the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents or the Intercreditor Agreement: (1) to cure any ambiguity, defect, error or inconsistency (including, for the avoidance of doubt, any inconsistency with any other provision in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture (including any supplemental indenture), the Floating Rate SSNs, any Note Guarantee, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any Floating Rate SSN Security Document or any disclosure in the Offering Memorandum) or reduce the minimum denomination of the Floating Rate SSNs; (2) to provide for uncertificated Floating Rate SSNs in addition to or in place of certificated Floating Rate SSNs; (3) to provide for the assumption of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s or a Floating Rate SSN Guarantor’s obligations to holders of Floating Rate SSNs and Note Guarantees in the case of a merger or consolidation or sale of all or substantially all of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer’s or such Floating Rate SSN Guarantor’s assets or in the case of a Permitted Reorganization or IPO Pushdown, as applicable, and make corresponding amendments; (4) to make any change that would provide any additional rights or benefits to the holders of Floating Rate SSNs or that does not adversely affect the legal rights under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture of any such holder in any material respect; (5) to conform the text of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents to any provision of this “Description of the Floating _Rate Senior Secured Notes” to the extent that such provision in this “Description of the Floating Rate Senior Secured Notes” was intended to be a verbatim recitation of a provision of the Floating Rate SSN_ Indenture, the Floating Rate SSNs, the Note Guarantees or the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (6) to enter into additional or supplemental Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (7) to release any Note Guarantee in accordance with the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (8) to release the Collateral in accordance with the terms of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture and the Floating Rate SSN Security Documents; (9) to provide for the issuance of Additional Floating Rate SSNs in accordance with the limitations set forth in the Floating Rate SSN Indenture; (10) to allow any Floating Rate SSN Guarantor to execute a supplemental indenture and/or a Note Guarantee with respect to the Floating Rate SSNs; 307 ----- (11) to evidence and provide the acceptance of the appointment of a successor Floating Rate SSN Trustee or the Security Agent under the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement, any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or any Floating Rate SSN Security Document; (12) as provided under “—Certain Covenants—Impairment of Security Interests” or “—Additional _Intercreditor Agreements”;_ (13) to comply with the covenant “—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets”; (14) to make any amendment to the provisions of the Floating Rate SSN Indenture relating to the transfer and legending of the Floating Rate SSNs as permitted by the Floating Rate SSN Indenture, including, without limitation, to facilitate the issuance and administration of the Floating Rate SSNs; provided that compliance with the Floating Rate SSN Indenture as so amended may not result in the Floating Rate SSNs being transferred in violation of the U.S. Securities Act or any applicable securities laws; or (15) to comply with the rules of any applicable securities depositary. The Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (where relevant) shall, at the direction of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, sign any supplemental indenture or other documentation that gives effect to amendments, supplements or waivers authorized as described under this heading “Amendment, Supplement and _Waiver” if the amendment, supplement or waiver does not impose any personal obligations on the Floating Rate_ SSN Trustee or the Security Agent. It shall only be necessary for the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee and the Security Agent (where relevant) to authorize and execute a supplemental indenture or other documentation in order to effect an amendment, waiver or supplement authorized as described under this heading “Amendment, Supplement and Waiver;” provided that, only the consent of the Floating Rate SSN Issuer, the Floating Rate SSN Trustee, the Security Agent (where relevant) and the relevant Additional Note Guarantor shall be required to give effect to any amendment or supplement providing for Additional Note Guarantees or security or modifying the terms of Note Guarantees or security pursuant to clauses (3), (5), (6), (7), (8), (10) or (12) above.
